member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcq1394DCAM.CameraBandwidth
member.summary: Reads or sets the camera bandwidth. Values limited to 0.0 (minimum) and 1.0 (maximum). Default is 1.0.

event.para: Fires when the bandwith value changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the camera bandwidth. Values range from 0.0, which directs the camera to consume as little bandwidth as possible, to 1.0, which directs the camera not to restrict its use of bandwidth.

This property lets you limit the amount of bandwidth used by an individual IEEE 1394 DCAM camera. You can connect more than one IEEE 1394 DCAM to a single IEEE 1394 adapter. By using this class, you can limit the amount of bandwidth used by individual cameras.
remarks.NOTE: Specifying a small (or zero) value for bandwidth may prevent some cameras from acquiring any images and cause the acquisition to return an error.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqBrightness.Brightness

event.para: Fires when the brightness is changed.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Reads or sets the brightness level.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the brightness level. This value ranges from 0.0 (darkest) to 1.0 (lightest).
Not all FIFOs support this property. Check whether the FIFO supports it, as in the example, before using this property.

The contrast and brightness values control how different light levels are mapped to pixel values. Assume that you are working with an 8-bit image. All the light levels entering the camera must be mapped to a pixel value from 0 to 255.

Brightness determines where the center of the contrast mapping window falls relative to the range of light levels. Brightness values closer to 0.0 place the center of the mapping window toward the higher light levels, resulting in a darker image.
Brightness values closer to 1.0 place the window toward the lower light levels, resulting in a brighter image.
For multichannel FIFOs, sets the brightness of all channels to the same value. To set the brightness of individual channels, use ..
remarks.DEFAULT:
CDC-50 camera: 0.58
CDC-100 camera: 0.50
CDC-200 camera: 0.50
All other cameras: 1.0

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqBrightnessMultiChannel.NumBrightnessChannels
member.summary: Returns the number of channels available to be set or read.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqCameraCalibration.RowColumnCalibrationEnabled

event.para: Fires when row and column calibration is enabled or disabled.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Read or set whether row and column calibration is enabled.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets whether row and column calibration is enabled.

When this option is enabled, VisionPro uses the CDC camera's factory settings to reduce the fixed pattern noise that causes pixel value variations from row to row and from column to column when presented with a scene of uniform intensity.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqCameraCalibration.OutlierPixelCorrectionEnabled

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets whether outlier pixel correction is enabled.

When this option is enabled, VisionPro uses the CDC camera's factory settings to determine whether a pixel is stuck on or off and corrects it to the average of its neighbors to the right and to the left.

Outlier correction is designed for naturally occurring images. It is not useful for images with many small features that you care about. For example, when acquiring images of a printout made with a laser printer or similar device, the dithering effects of the printer will appear as small features which the outlier correction would remove. In this case, outlier correction should not be used.

event.para: Fires when outlier pixel correction is enabled or disabled.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Read or set whether outlier pixel correction is enabled.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqChargeTransferInterval.ChargeTransferInterval
member.summary: Reads or sets the charge transfer interval in units of video lines relative to the beginning of the vertical drive signal.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqContrast.Contrast

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the contrast level. This value ranges from 0.0 (least contrast) to 1.0 (most contrast).
Not all FIFOs support this property. Check whether the FIFO supports it, as in the example, before using this property.

The contrast and brightness values control how different light levels are mapped to pixel values. Assume that you are working with an 8-bit image. All the light levels entering the camera must be mapped to a pixel value from 0 to 255.
Contrast determines how the light levels are mapped to the 256 light levels. A low value closer to 0.0 maps more light values to the pixel value range.

A high value closer to 1.0 maps fewer light values to the pixel value range. Light values that are below or above the contrast threshold are mapped to the lowest and highest pixel values, respectively.
For multichannel FIFOs, sets the contrast of all channels to the same value. To set the contrast of individual channels, use ..
remarks.DEFAULT:
CDC-50 camera: 0.15
CDC-100 camera: 0.66
CDC-200 camera: 0.45
All other cameras: 0.35

member.summary: Reads or sets the contrast level. Contrast values are in the range 0-1 inclusive.

The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqDigitalCameraGain.DigitalHighGainSelected
member.summary: Reads or sets whether using high A/D gain.

event.para: Fires when the gain selection changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the camera's analog/digital (A/D) gain setting.
Not all FIFOs support this property. Check whether the FIFO supports it, as in the example, before using this property.
The gain can be either high (True) or low (False).
Some digital cameras provide only manual gain control by means of a physical switch or a dial in the camera. However, some digital cameras support gain selection by means of a control line.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqExposure.MinExposure

remarks.PARA: Minimum exposure time in milliseconds.

member.summary: Minimum exposure time in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqExposure.Exposure
member.summary: Reads or sets the exposure time in milliseconds. The special value of zero indicates to use the smallest supported time.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the exposure time in milliseconds. The special value zero indicates to use the shortest time that the camera supports.

For strobed acquisitions, this value is the duration of the strobe pulse. To find the pulse duration of your strobe, see the strobe light’s specifications. Note that this function is used to let the acquisition software know the duration of the strobe pulse, not to set the duration of the strobe pulse.
To determine the exposure time for Cognex CDC cameras, see How to Choose a CDC Shutter Mode.

If you are using a FireWire (IEEE 1394DCAM) camera, the exposure value may be an absolute time in milliseconds or a a register value. Check with the documentation supplied with your camera to determine whether your camera supports absolute exposure times. In cases where the register value can be multiplied by a constant to obtain and absolute exposure, the camera's CCF provides the necessary information to use absolute values. In all other case, you must use the raw register value.
You can use the DCAM Doctor application included in your VisionPro distribution to learn about the properties of your FireWire camera.

event.para: Fires when the exposure changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqLineScan.UseSingleChannel
member.summary: Reads or sets whether only one channel of the encoder signal is used for acquisition.

remarks.PARA: If UseSingleChannel is set to true, it might be possible to connect only a single encoder channel as encoder input instead of using a quadrature dual channel type encoder. The channel that is used depends upon the setting of . If is true, channel A is used. If false, channel B is used.
One advantage of using a single channel encoder input is in some cases it might be desirable to acquire without considering the direction of motion of the encoder.
This property applies only to the MVS-8600/8600e platform. Only the MVS-8600/8600e platform supports this function.
remarks.DEFAULT: The default value is false indicating both encoder channels A and B are considered for acquisition on platforms supporting this functionality.

This means that the encoder port you specify must be consistent with the camera port of the FIFO that this property is associated with. See the documentation for the Cognex Video Module (CVM) that you are using for supported encoder/camera port settings.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqLineScan.CurrentEncoderCount
member.summary: Current value of the encoder.

remarks.PARA: The current value of the encoder.

The Cognex MVS-8600 does not provide an absolute encoder position counter. On that platform, this property returns the product of the number of the line being acquired and the steps per line encoder setting. This value may not be accurate if the encoder travels backwards during acquisition. If you are using the test encoder the steps per line value is ignored, so this property returns the currently acquired line number. If there is no acquisition in progress, the value of this property is zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqLineScan.AcquireDirectionPositive

remarks.PARA: Set/get the current acquire direction. If true, the encoder needs to be travelling in the positive direction (i.e. increasing encoder values) for acquisition to begin. If false, the encoder needs to be travelling in the negative direction (i.e. decreasing values) for acquisition to begin. Acqusition can be started either by the hardware means determined by or a software command (with manual trigger model).
For platforms which support encoder-triggered acquisitions, the specified acquire direction is only enforced when
- is set to true,
- there is a valid setting for , and,
- the trigger model is not Manual.
Unlike , this method does not dictate whether the encoder count increments or decrements. The encoder's direction of travel determines that.
remarks.DEFAULT: The default value of direction is true.

event.para: Fires when the direction changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Reads or sets whether the Acquire direction is positive.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqLineScan.ResetCounter

remarks.PARA: Resets the encoder counter.

The Cognex MVS-8600 does not provide an absolute encoder position counter. There is, however, a counter that keeps track of any backward encoder pulses that the hardware detects when the encoder is moving opposite to the expected acquisition direction. Acquisition will not begin until forward motion resets this counter. Calling this method clears the backward encoder pulse counter and causes acquisition to begin right away without waiting for compensating forward counts.

member.summary: Reset encoder counter.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqSettlingTime.SettlingTime
member.summary: Reads or sets the settling time in milliseconds.

exception.para: The acquisition trigger model is Slave.

event.para: Fires when the settling time is changed.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the settling time in milliseconds.
In general, you should not need to use this interface, and you should select a video format that supports your application.

This interface allows you to specify the settling time, the time to wait after a trigger before starting an acquisition. Typically, you would specify a settling time when using a free-running camera with automatic triggering and ambient illumination to allow a part to stop moving once it is in position. The settling time should be long enough to ensure that no portion of the image is in motion during image integration.

To choose an appropriate settling time, you need to consider the characteristics of the part as well as the latencies of integrating the image. A conservative settling time depends on whether the camera is a rapid-reset camera or free-running and whether a strobe is used.

The following examples illustrate appropriate choices for settling time so that the image is not blurred. In each example, the grey bars denote frames that were integrated while the part was still in motion; the solid green bars denote frames that were integrated after the part stopped moving.
The following figure shows a free-running camera with no strobe in frame integration mode.
The following figure shows a free-running camera with no strobe in field integration mode.
The following figure shows a rapid-reset camera with no strobe.
For a strobed acquisition, the settling time should be zero.

member.summary: Get or set strobe delay.

event.para: Fires when the strobe delay changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the strobe delay in milliseconds. The strobe delay is the delay time between the shutter pulse and the strobe firing.
The strobe delay can be a negative value so that the strobe pulse fires before the shutter pulse. Negative values are useful when you are using slower strobes such as LED strobes.
To determine the delay time for Cognex CDC cameras, see How to Choose a CDC Shutter Mode.

If you are using a frame grabber that supports CVM11, you can specify encoder-triggered acquisition which is a special case of hardware triggering for line scan cameras. To use encoder triggering, set the trigger model as Auto or Semi and set the property.

member.summary: Get or set period of time in milliseconds between trigger and start of camera integration.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the period of time in milliseconds between the trigger and start of camera integration.

On a Cognex MVS-8600 frame grabber, the delay is rounded to the nearest multiple of the horizontal line period. With a linescan camera, the delay takes effect for every line instead of every frame. You can use this property wth a test encoder to vary the line rate.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqTriggerFilter.MinTriggerPeriod

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the minimum time between triggers in milliseconds. Only the first valid trigger within a period will initiate a camera integration cycle. Other valid triggers in that same period are missed. You can use this value to help limit the camera acquisition rate.
Legal values range from 0 to 65.5. Zero specifies that there is no period requirement.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the minimum trigger width in milliseconds. The trigger input signal must be asserted for at least this amount of time before it is recognized as a valid input trigger. If the trigger does not meet this width constraint, it is ignored.
The latency between the edge transition of the trigger signal and the start of camera integration is computed as ( + ).
The legal values range from 0.003 to 0.258.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqGigEVisionTransport.PacketSize
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfPacketSize
member.summary: Reads or sets the size of image packets transmitted by the camera. The default is the value that was automatically determined, and will vary based on the camera used and network configuration. In most cases, the packetSize value should not be changed from the default. Ideally, the automatically determined value will be 8000 or larger. A smaller value may indicate that jumbo frames are disabled on the network adapter, or that a switch in the network does not support jumbo frames. The packetSize function controls the GevSCPSPacketSize feature of the camera.
member.value: Impacts the size of image packets transmitted by the camera.
member.exception: If the supplied value is less than 1 or greater than PacketSizeMax.

member.summary: Reads or sets the maximum timeout, in milliseconds, for the camera to transmit an image. Adjust the transport timeout to a larger value to allow successful acquisition from cameras with a long readout time, as may occur with a linescan camera. Default timeout value is 2000 ms.
member.exception: If the supplied value is less than 0.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfTransportTimeout

member.value: Applies to the area of the sensor used for laser detection.
member.summary: When true, the base of Zone 2 is linked to the top of Zone 1, such that changes to Zone 1 will automatically make a corresponding adjustment to Zone 2. This is useful when adjusting the distance between the camera and the object being imaged, as both zones can adjusted by changing only the Zone 1 base. Note that as the LinkDetectionZones setting is turned on and off, the value of zDetectionBase2 will automatically toggle between an absolute and relative value.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfLinkDetectionZones

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqProfileCamera.BridgeDetectionZones
member.value: Applies to the area of the sensor used for laser detection.
member.summary: When true, the enabled detection zones are combined into a single zone starting at the bottom of the lowest zone and ending at the top of the highest zone. The ZDetectionSampling setting from Zone 1 is used for the entire combined zone.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfBridgeDetectionZones

member.summary: Enables or disables the first detection zone.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqProfileCamera.ZDetectionHeight2
member.exception: If the supplied value is less than 0 or its value plus ZDetectionBase is greater than ZDetectionHeightMax.
member.summary: Reads or sets the area of the sensor used for laser detection. ZDetectionHeight2 is the height, in mm, of the second detection range starting at ZDetectionBase2. A smaller ZDetectionHeight2 increases the maximum line rate when acquiring range images, but reduces the measurement range. When converting ZDetectionHeight2 to discrete sensor rows, the range may be expanded slightly to match the sensor capabilities. The range will only be reduced if it extends off the end of the sensor. This function can be used to ignore reflections and other artifacts that are outside the expected range of heights.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfZDetectionHeight
member.value: The height, in mm, of the second detection zone.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqProfileCamera.ZDetectionHeight
member.value: Applies to the area of the sensor used for laser detection.
member.summary: Reads or sets the area of the sensor used for laser detection. ZDetectionHeight is the height, in mm, of the first detection range stating at ZDetectionBase. A smaller ZDetectionHeight increases the maximum line rate when acquiring range images, but reduces the measurement range. When converting ZDetectionHeight to discrete sensor rows, the range may be expanded slightly to match the sensor capabilities. The range will only be reduced if it extends off the end of the sensor. This function can be used to ignore reflections and other artifacts that are outside the expected range of heights.
member.exception: If the supplied value is less than 0 or its value plus ZDetectionBase2 is greater than ZDetectionHeightMax.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfZDetectionHeight

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogAcqProfileCamera.ZDetectionBase2
member.exception: If the supplied value is less than 0 or its value plus ZDetectionHeight is greater than ZDetectionHeightMax.
member.summary: Reads or sets the area of the sensor used for laser detection. ZDetectionBase2 is the distance, in mm, where the detection range begins. The value is relative to either the top of the first detection zone if LinkDetectionZones is true and the first zone is enabled, or the camera defined origin of the Z axis otherwise. When converting ZDetectionBase2 to discrete sensor rows, the range may be expanded slightly to match the sensor capabilities. The range will only be reduced if it extends off the end of the sensor. This function can be used to ignore reflections and other artifacts that are outside the expected range of heights.
member.value: Applies to the area of the sensor used for laser detection.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfZDetectionBase

member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected: SfZDetectionBase
member.summary: Reads or sets the area of the sensor used for laser detection. ZDetectionBase is the distance, in mm, relative to the camera defined origin of the Z axis, where the first detection range begins. When converting ZDetectionBase to discrete sensor rows, the range may be expanded slightly to match the sensor capabilities. The range will only be reduced if it extends off the end of the sensor. This function can be used to ignore reflections and other artifacts that are outside the expected range of heights.
member.value: Applies to the area of the sensor used for laser detection.
member.exception: If the supplied value is less than 0 or its value plus ZDetectionHeight is greater than ZDetectionHeightMax.

member.summary: Reads or sets the dimensions of image pixels in mm in the X direction. Defaults to the scaling of sensor pixels at the closest. Used when generating range images. Defaults to the scaling of sensor pixels at the closest distance from the camera that can be measured. This insures no information is lost in range images for objects close to the camera, but it increases the width of the range image.
member.value: The dimensions of image pixels in mm in the X direction.

param.PARA: The position to move to. Zero moves to the beginning of the sequence, and −1 moves to the end of the sequence.

exception.para: is out of range or not a valid value.
The iterator is not valid because the item set has changed. For example, the iterator is pointing to an item that was removed from the .

remarks.PARA: Moves the iterator to the specified position in the sequence, loading that item's properties into this iterator.
Use to obtain valid positions within the sequence.
If is zero, the iterator moves to the beginning of the sequence. If is −1 it moves to the end of the sequence. However, is not necessarily an item index into the iterator.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogGeneralContourEllipticalArcSegmentIterator.MoveToNext

exception.para: The iterator is at the end. ( is True.)
The iterator is not valid because the item set has changed. For example, the iterator is pointing to an item that was removed from the .

remarks.PARA: Moves the iterator to the next position, loading that item's properties into this iterator.
If the iterator is at the end position, returns an error. You may wish to check before calling to avoid errors.

member.summary: Moves the iterator to the next position, loading that item's properties into this iterator. If the iterator is at the end position, an error is returned. To avoid getting errors, you may wish to check IsEnd.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogGeneralContourEllipticalArcSegmentIterator.MoveToPrevious

exception.para: The iterator is at the beginning. ( is True.)
The iterator is not valid because the item set has changed. For example, the iterator is pointing to an item that was removed from the .

remarks.PARA: Moves the iterator to the previous position, loading that item's properties into this iterator.
If there are no items before the current position, returns an error. You may wish to check before calling to avoid errors.

member.summary: Moves the iterator to the previous position, loading that item's properties into this iterator. If there are no items before this, an error is returned. To avoid getting errors, you may wish to check IsFirst.

param.name: indexOffset
param.PARA: The offset from the current position.

remarks.PARA: Makes a copy of this iterator. The copy is positioned at the same item as this item plus the given . For example, if is +1 the copy will be positioned at the next item; if is −1, the copy will be at the previous item.

exception.para: would place the iterator beyond the end iterator ( is True) or before the start iterator ( is True).
The iterator is not valid; however if is True (and there are no other errors), this iterator will be copied.

member.summary: Makes a copy of this iterator. The copy will be positioned at the same item as this plus the given IndexOffset. For example, if IndexOffset is +1 the copy will be positioned at the next item, if IndexOffset is -1, the copy will be at the previous item.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogImage8PixelMemory

remarks.PARA: Interface to an object that provides direct pointer access to 8-bit image pixel memory. Use to get an object.

objects are intended for temporary use within functions that read or write pixel data. Caching an object for long periods of time could lead to memory congestion. You must call when you are finished using the object to release any resources that it uses. After you do so, any pointer that returned becomes invalid.

If you request read/write or write-only access to the pixel memory when you call , the pixel memory may be copied internally. Any changes that you make to the pixel may not be written back to the image until you call . Your application should assume that no changes to the image take place until then.

member.summary: Virtual (noncreatable) class for accessing the interface that provides direct pointer access to 8-bit image pixels.

member.summary: Returns/sets the polarity of this feature. The polarity of a given feature may be -1, 0(undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or -1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry, and 0 means undefined.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogModelFeatureIteratorGC.ParentFeature
member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

exception.para: The new value is not in .

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the polarity of this feature.
The polarity of a given feature may be −1, 0 (undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or −1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry.

member.summary: Returns/sets the polarity of this feature. The polarity of a given feature may be -1, 0(undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or -1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry, and 0 means undefined.

event.para: Fires when the polarity changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.Weight
member.summary: Returns/sets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model. The weight defaults to 1.0.

event.para: Fires when the weight changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.ParentFeature

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.param: Should be set to true when called from your public Dispose() method, thus disposing of all managed and unmanaged resources. It should be set to false when called from your Finalizer, thus disposing of only unmanaged resources.
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this class instance. Only derived classes that implement Dispose should call this method; Other clients who wish to explicitly release resources should call IDisposable.Dispose. Do not attempt to access an object after it has been disposed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.CreateSubFeatureIterator(System.Int32)

param.name: initialIndex
param.PARA: The initial position of the iterator. If this value is −1, the iterator is positioned after the last valid subfeature.

member.summary: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by InitialIndex. A value of -1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
member.PARA: does not fire events, but will fire events if the subfeatures are modified.

remarks.PARA: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by . A value of −1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
Most shape models do not have subfeatures, so it is not unusual for this method to return Nothing (or NULL). Only objects have subfeatures.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.GetEffectiveWeight

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective weight of this feature
If this feature does not have a its effective weight is the value of . If it does have a its effective weight is the times the effective weight of the .

member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective weight is the value of the Weight property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective weight is the Weight times the effective weight of the ParentFeature.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.GetEffectivePolarity
member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective polarity is the value of the Polarity property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective polarity is the Polarity times the effective polarity of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective polarity of this feature.
If this feature does not have a its effective polarity is the value of . If it does have a its effective polarity is the times the effective polarity of the .

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelCircle.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

and
are applied to this shape when it is used as a synthetic model.
This is a read-only property. To create a shape model, use the shape's MakeShapeModel method. For instance, to create a shape model for a circle, you would use CogCircle.MakeShapeModel.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.Polarity

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the polarity of this feature.
The polarity of a given feature may be −1, 0 (undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or −1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry.

member.summary: Returns/sets the polarity of this feature. The polarity of a given feature may be -1, 0(undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or -1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry, and 0 means undefined.

event.para: Fires when the polarity changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

exception.para: The new value is not in .

member.summary: Returns/sets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model. The weight defaults to 1.0.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model.

event.para: Fires when the weight changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.ParentFeature
member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.CreateSubFeatureIterator(System.Int32)

param.name: initialIndex
param.PARA: The initial position of the iterator. If this value is −1, the iterator is positioned after the last valid subfeature.

member.PARA: does not fire events, but will fire events if the subfeatures are modified.

remarks.PARA: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by . A value of −1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
Most shape models do not have subfeatures, so it is not unusual for this method to return Nothing (or NULL). Only objects have subfeatures.

member.summary: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by InitialIndex. A value of -1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.GetEffectiveWeight
member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective weight is the value of the Weight property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective weight is the Weight times the effective weight of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective weight of this feature
If this feature does not have a its effective weight is the value of . If it does have a its effective weight is the times the effective weight of the .

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.GetEffectivePolarity

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective polarity of this feature.
If this feature does not have a its effective polarity is the value of . If it does have a its effective polarity is the times the effective polarity of the .

member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective polarity is the value of the Polarity property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective polarity is the Polarity times the effective polarity of the ParentFeature.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipse.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the polarity of this feature.
The polarity of a given feature may be −1, 0 (undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or −1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry.

exception.para: The new value is not in .

member.summary: Returns/sets the polarity of this feature. The polarity of a given feature may be -1, 0(undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or -1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry, and 0 means undefined.

event.para: Fires when the polarity changes.

member.summary: Returns/sets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model. The weight defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.ParentFeature
member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.CreateSubFeatureIterator(System.Int32)

param.name: initialIndex
param.PARA: The initial position of the iterator. If this value is −1, the iterator is positioned after the last valid subfeature.

member.summary: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by InitialIndex. A value of -1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by . A value of −1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
Most shape models do not have subfeatures, so it is not unusual for this method to return Nothing (or NULL). Only objects have subfeatures.

member.PARA: does not fire events, but will fire events if the subfeatures are modified.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.GetEffectiveWeight
member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective weight is the value of the Weight property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective weight is the Weight times the effective weight of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective weight of this feature
If this feature does not have a its effective weight is the value of . If it does have a its effective weight is the times the effective weight of the .

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.GetEffectivePolarity

If this feature does not have a its effective polarity is the value of . If it does have a its effective polarity is the times the effective polarity of the .

member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelEllipticalArc.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

member.summary: Returns/sets the polarity of this feature. The polarity of a given feature may be -1, 0(undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or -1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry, and 0 means undefined.

event.para: Fires when the weight changes.

member.summary: Returns/sets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model. The weight defaults to 1.0.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.ParentFeature
member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.CreateSubFeatureIterator(System.Int32)

param.name: initialIndex
param.PARA: The initial position of the iterator. If this value is −1, the iterator is positioned after the last valid subfeature.

member.summary: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by InitialIndex. A value of -1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
member.PARA: does not fire events, but will fire events if the subfeatures are modified.

remarks.PARA: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by . A value of −1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
Most shape models do not have subfeatures, so it is not unusual for this method to return Nothing (or NULL). Only objects have subfeatures.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.GetEffectiveWeight
member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective weight is the value of the Weight property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective weight is the Weight times the effective weight of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective weight of this feature
If this feature does not have a its effective weight is the value of . If it does have a its effective weight is the times the effective weight of the .

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.GetEffectivePolarity
member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective polarity is the value of the Polarity property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective polarity is the Polarity times the effective polarity of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective polarity of this feature.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelGeneralContour.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelLine.ParentFeature
member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelLine.CreateSubFeatureIterator(System.Int32)

param.name: initialIndex
param.PARA: The initial position of the iterator. If this value is −1, the iterator is positioned after the last valid subfeature.

member.summary: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by InitialIndex. A value of -1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
member.PARA: does not fire events, but will fire events if the subfeatures are modified.

remarks.PARA: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by . A value of −1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
Most shape models do not have subfeatures, so it is not unusual for this method to return Nothing (or NULL). Only objects have subfeatures.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelLine.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelLine.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

param.name: boundingRectangle

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelLineSegment.ParentFeature

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelLineSegment.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

is called.

The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective weight is the value of the Weight property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective weight is the Weight times the effective weight of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective weight of this feature
If this feature does not have a its effective weight is the value of . If it does have a its effective weight is the times the effective weight of the .

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelPolygon.GetEffectivePolarity

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective polarity of this feature.
If this feature does not have a its effective polarity is the value of . If it does have a its effective polarity is the times the effective polarity of the .

member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective polarity is the value of the Polarity property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective polarity is the Polarity times the effective polarity of the ParentFeature.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelPolygon.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelPolygon.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelPolygon.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelRectangleAffine.ParentFeature
member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

remarks.PARA: Returns a newly created iterator for iterating over all subfeatures. The iterator is positioned at the subfeature specified by . A value of −1 creates an iterator that is positioned just after the last valid subfeature.
Most shape models do not have subfeatures, so it is not unusual for this method to return Nothing (or NULL). Only objects have subfeatures.

member.PARA: does not fire events, but will fire events if the subfeatures are modified.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.Internal.CogShapeModelRectangleAffine.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.
