member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogToolUtility
member.summary: This class provides utility functions for implementing VisionPro tools.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Implementation.CogToolUtility.CloneRegionForInspectionRecord(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRegion,Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,Cognex.VisionPro.CogColorConstants)
member.param: The region to be cloned.

This image will be used to ensure that the SelectedSpaceName of the cloned region is not a partially-qualified name. (Graphics with partially-qualified names are typically not used in inspection records because their location may be misleading on some images.) Note that the SelectedSpaceName of the cloned region will be exactly the same as the SelectedSpaceName of the original region if (1) the name is not partially-qualified, or (2) this image is null.
The color of the cloned region. If set to CogColorConstants.None, the clone will retain the color of the original region.
member.summary: Clone a tool's Region shape for use in a LastRun inspection record. If the region is an interactive graphic the clone will adjusted so that it's Interactive and Selected properties are both set to false.
member.returns: The cloned region, as an ICogRegion interface.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogRLEBufferNotInitializedException

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogRLEBufferCombineFailedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a cannot combine two images. Typically, this error means that the subimage exceeds the primary image's bounds.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogRLEBufferCombineSubImageSizeException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the subimage size is greater than the RLE buffer. The subimage must fit entirely in the RLE buffer.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogRLEBufferCombineSubImageOffsetException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the subimage's x- or y-position is less than the RLE buffer's (x,y) position. The subimage must fit entirely in the RLE buffer.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogRLEBufferCombineSubImageExtentException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the subimage extends beyond the size of the RLE buffer.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogIOLineNotEnabledException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the I/O line in use is not enabled. It must first be enabled before you can change it's value.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogIOLineCannotEnableException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when this I/O line cannot be enabled. It may be possible to enable it if other lines are first disabled.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogMathUnsupportedGeometryException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the mathematical operation is not supported with the specified coordinate transformations.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogIteratorInvalidIteratorException

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogIteratorInvalidPositionException

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogIteratorEndOfContainerException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the iterator is at the end of the collection.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogCollectionInvalidIndexException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the specified index is not valid for the collection. The index value should be greater than zero and less than the collection item count.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogCollectionInvalidKeyException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the specified key is not a valid key value. The key is a string that uniquely identifies an item in the collection.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogCollectionKeyNotFoundException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the specified key string was not found in the collection. Keys are case-sensitive.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogCollectionDuplicateItemException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the item already exists in the collection.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogCollectionDuplicateKeyException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the key already exists in the collection. Key strings must be unique. Keys are case-sensitive.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogCollectionNullItemException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a collection item cannot be null or empty.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqBadVideoFormatException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the video format is not recognized, or no connected camera supports the video format.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqTimeoutException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the period expires.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqInvalidROIException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the is not valid.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqOverrunException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a trigger could not be serviced.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqBadTicketException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when there is no outstanding for the supplied ticket.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqOldTicketException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the ticked supplied corresponds to an image that has already been collected.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqNoFrameGrabberException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a FIFO was not associated with a frame grabber.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqWrongTriggerModelException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the acquisition trigger model selected is not compatible with the type of acquisition performed by an acquisition FIFO. For example, it is an error to call the Acquire method when the trigger model is 'Auto'. See <see cref="P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogAcqTrigger.TriggerModel"> for more information.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqMissedException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the FIFO fills up. The size of the FIFO queue is 32 requests.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqAbnormalException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when the acquisition fails because of a fault in the acquisition hardware, or because of some other unusual problem. This failure should never happen in a properly functioning system. Some examples of abnormal failures are a blown camera fuse or a temperature alert that indicates that the frame grabber is overheating.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqNotAllowedForSlaveException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when you attempt an illegal operation on a slave FIFO.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqCannotSlaveException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a FIFO cannot have a slave FIFO because of incompatible video formats or because there are no available ports for slave FIFOs.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqTimingException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a timing error occurs.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqHardwareInUseException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when another process is using the hardware resource. Only a single process per computer can make use of Cognex hardware.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqNoCamerasException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when no cameras are available with which to acquire an image.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqOtherFifoErrorException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when there was an error in another FIFO in the same master/slave group.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqNoOutstandingStartsException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an acquisition ticket is -1, but there are no outstanding StartAcquire requests.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqEncoderOverrunException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when an encoder overrun occurs.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqTooManyStartsException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when no more acquisition requests can be made. The limit is 32 acquisition requests. You must call either CompleteAcquire or Flush to remove completed acquisition requests from the acquisition FIFO.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqCannotCreateFifoException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a FIFO cannot be created (digital or linescan cameras only).

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Exceptions.CogAcqRegisterAccessException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a register read or write access has failed (digital cameras only).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogOverrunEventArgs.Ticket
member.summary: If the event fired because of a missed trigger, this value will be zero. If the event fired because of a Fifo overrun, this value will be the nonzero ticket returned by StartAcquire. You can use this value to determine which acquisition request fired this event. If this acquisition was automatically triggered (not by StartAcquire), then the value of Ticket is undefined.

remarks.para:
If this event fired because of a FIFO overrun, this value is the non-zero ticket that
returns. You can use this value to determine which acquisition request fired this event.

If the event fired because of a missed trigger, this value is zero. However, although you can create an event handler, not every Cognex frame grabber provides the hardware necessary to detect a missed trigger. In particular, following frame grabbers cannot detect missed triggers:
MVS-8100L
MVS-8100M
MVS-8600
1394DCAM Cameras
If this acquisition was automatically triggered, and not initiated with , then the value of is undefined.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVertexChangedEventArgs
member.summary: This class holds data provided by the VertexChanged event. The VertexChanged event fires in addition to the standard Changed event after the x-coordinate, y-coordinate, or both have changed for a single vertex. The change may occur as a result of calling a Polygon's SetVertexX(), SetVertexY(), or SetVertex() methods. It also may occur if the vertex position is manipulated interactively in a display.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVertexChangedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: The index of the changed vertex. In the range of zero to one less than the number of vertices in the CogPolygon.
The new x-coordinate.
The new y-coordinate.
member.summary: Construct the CogVertexChangedEventArgs object with the supplied index, x-coordinate, and y-coordinate. The x-coordinate and y-coordinate values reflect those of the specified vertex after the change has been made.

member.summary: The new y-coordinate.

member.summary: The new x-coordinate.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVertexChangedEventArgs.Index
member.summary: The index of the changed vertex. In the range of zero to one less than the number of vertices in the CogPolygon.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVertexAddedEventArgs
member.summary: This class holds data provided by the VertexAdded event. The VertexAdded event fires after one, or possibly several vertices are added to the CogPolygon as a result of calling AddVertex() or NumVertices().

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVertexAddedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.param: The index of the added vertex. -1 means that new vertices were added at the end until the number of vertices equaled newNumVertices.
X-coordinate of the new vertex.
Y-coordinate of the new vertex.
The new number of vertices in the CogPolygon.
member.summary: Construct the CogVertexAddedEventArgs object with the supplied index, x-coordinate, y-coordinate, and new number of vertices. When the VertexAdded event has been caused by calling NumVertices() with an argument greater than the existing number of vertices, the index will be -1 (i.e. added to the end of the list of vertices) and the x-coordinate and y-coordinate will both be zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVertexAddedEventArgs.Index
member.summary: The index of the added vertex. -1 means that new vertices were added at the end until the number of vertices equaled newNumVertices.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs
member.summary: This class provides data for the BusConfigurationChanged event of 1394DCAM frame grabbers.

remarks.para:
In general, the only appropriate action for your application to take in reponse to a
event is to exit the application gracefully. Once this event fires, the acquisition hardware and software may no longer be consistent, and the only way to fix that is to restart the application.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: n/a
n/a
n/a
n/a
n/a
n/a
n/a
n/a
member.summary: Constructor for these EventArgs. You typically will not need to use this method.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.BusGenerationCount
member.summary: The IEEE 1394 bus generation count at the time of the bus reset. Will be in the range [0, 255]. This value rolls over, that is, the next value after 255 is 0. Valid only if BusReset is true.

remarks.para: This property is meaningful only when is True.
Every time the IEEE1394 bus is reset, this value increases by 1. When the count reaches 255, it rolls over to 0.
If is False, this property is -1.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.NodeCount
member.summary: The number of nodes on the IEEE 1394 bus. Will be in the range [2, 64]. Valid only if BusReset is true.

remarks.para: This property is meaningful only when is True.
Returns the number of nodes on this bus after the bus reset. This value will be in the range 2 to 64. Node 0 is the host (the IEEE 1394 adapter) and this camera.
If is False, this property is 0.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.HostNodeNumber
member.summary: The node number of the host device on the IEEE 1394 bus. Will be in the range [0, 63]. Valid only BusReset is true.

remarks.para: This property is meaningful only when is True.

This property returns the identifying node number (in the range 0 to 63) of the host on the IEEE1394 bus after reset This is typically the highest node number on the bus. This value changes if a node has been removed.
If is False, this property is -1.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.NodeNumberChanged
member.summary: True if the node number of this camera changed as a result of the bus reset. Valid only if BusReset is true.

remarks.para: This property is meaningful only when is True.
If True, this device's node number changed as a result of the bus reset.
If is False, this property is also False.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.BusResetInitiatorNodeNumber
member.summary: The node number of the device on the IEEE 1394 bus that was reported to have initiated the bus reset. Valid only if BusReset is true.

remarks.para: This property is meaningful only when is True.
This property returns the node number of the device that initiated the bus reset. This is the number after any node renumbering has taken place due to a change in topology.
If is False, this property is -1.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.BusResetInitiator
member.summary: True if the camera initiated the bus reset. Valid only if BusReset is true.

remarks.para: This property is meaningful only when is True.
When this property is True, this device initiated the bus reset. If this property is False, another device on the IEE1394 bus initiated the reset.
If is False, this property is also False.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.BusReset
member.summary: True if the BusConfigurationChanged event is the result of an IEEE 1394 bus reset.

remarks.para: This property is True if the event fired as a result of a camera or another device connected to this IEEE1394 bus initiating the bus reset. If this property is True, is False.
If this property is True, then is False.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Cog1394DCAMBusConfigurationChangedEventArgs.Unplugged
member.summary: True if the BusConfigurationChanged event is the result of the camera being unplugged.

remarks.para: If True, this camera has been unplugged from the IEEE1394 bus. No other information is available about this device.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqInfo
member.summary: Provides information about a completed acquisition.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqInfo.TimeStamp
member.remarks: In case of GigE camera the Timestamp is generated in the camera when an acquire occurs. This is the most precise, but requires synchronization with the PC timer. In case of 8500 the Timestamp is generated when the driver reads the PC timer. Interrupt latencies may cause some minor errors in the timestamp. On all other platforms the Timestamp is generated when the acquisition code reads the PC timer. Windows latencies may cause significant errors in the timestamp.
member.summary: The timestamp associated with the acquired image.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateSpaceTree
member.summary: Tree of user coordinate spaces and the mappings between them.

remarks.PARA: , the primary interface for a object, implements functionality related to the coordinate space tree associated with each VisionPro image.

In VisionPro, you can define and name your own coordinate spaces. Each time you calibrate an image or create a fixture, VisionPro creates a new, named user space. Each user space is defined, relative to an existing space, by a two-dimensional transform. The coordinate space tree contains a node for each coordinate space associated with an image, and maintains information about the transform that produced it. VisionPro also maintains a root space based on the pixels in the acquired image.

The methods and properties in this interface let you obtain the transformations that map points between any pair of coordinate spaces in the space tree. They also allow you to examine, add to, or rearrange the space tree.

Many of the methods use a client-specified coordinate space name to find a coordinate space within the tree. You can supply any valid nonqualified (NQ) or fully-qualified (FQ) pathname. If you supply a NQ name, the method searches the coordinate space tree for instances of that name. The NQ name must occur exactly once within the tree.

In addition, several methods return one or more coordinate space names. You can control the format (nonqualified, partially-qualified, or fully-qualified) of the returned names by supplying a value. If a partially-qualified (PQ) name is returned, it begins with either "." or "..", and specifies a space relative to the given space name.

param.name: duplicateHandling
param.PARA: A value that specifies what do if the parent coordinate space already contains an immediate child with the same name as . The options are to return an error, replace the transform of the named child, or do nothing. defaults to DuplicateIsError: it treats a duplicate as an error.

member.summary: Add a new coordinate space, with the given name and transform, to this tree. Attach it to the specified pre-existing parent space.
member.EVENT: NewSpaceName Fires when a space is added to this tree.

remarks.PARA: Adds a new user coordinate space to a object. You must specify the name of the parent space for the newly added space, and supply a transformation that defines the relationship between the parent space and the new space.
To indicate that the parent space is the root space, use the name syntax "@"; to indicate that the current selected space is the parent space, use "." as the name syntax.

By default, saves a copy of the supplied transform. You can also add the transform by-reference. Although this is more efficient, it may result in errors for users who unknowingly continue to modify the original transform object.

member.summary: Add a tree of coordinate spaces to the given ParentSpaceName of this tree using the supplied ParentFromTreeRoot transform. The tree is added by reference, so any changes to it will be visible to clients of both trees.

exception.para: value is not a member of .

value is not a legal space name.
is a nonqualified space name and more than one instance of it exists in this tree.

remarks.PARA: Adds a tree of coordinate spaces to the given parent space name of this tree. You must also supply a transformation that defines the relationship between the parent space and the root of the new spaces.

By default, saves a copy of the supplied transform. You can also add the transform by-reference. Although this is more efficient, it may result in errors for users who unknowingly continue to modify the original transform object.

Trees are added by-reference. If you copy the parent tree, the copy contains an additional reference to the supplied tree. You must avoid creating new trees that contain circular references to other coordinate space trees.

member.EVENT: NewSpaceName Fires when a tree is added to this tree.

member.summary: Occurs after a transform is changed in this tree. Note that the meaning of any spaces descending from the changed transform will also be altered. This event can be fired in a variety of ways. For example: (1) by a call to the ChangeTransform method, (2) by call to the AddSpace method that replaces an existing transform, (3) by modifying a transform that was added to the tree by reference (not copied).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqFifoTool.GarbageCollectionFrequency
member.exception: If you attempt to set this value less than one.
member.value: An integer greater than zero, specifying the number of times the tool can run before explicit garbage collection.
member.summary: If GarbageCollectionEnabled is true, this property specifies the number of times that the tool can be run before the tool will make an explicit call to the garbage collector. This property is ignored if GarbageCollectionEnabled is false.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqFifoTool.GarbageCollectionEnabled
member.value: A boolean specifying whether this tool will periodically make an explicit call to the garbage collector.
member.summary: If true, this tool will call garbage collection (i.e. System.GC.Collect()) after it has been run a specified number of times. If false, garbage collection will never be called explicitly by this tool. The GarbageCollectionFrequency property specifies the number of times that the tool can be run before garbage collection will occur.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: If true, the Run method will invoke StartAcquire and CompleteAcquire on the operator in semi trigger mode. If false, only CompleteAcquire will be invoked.

member.summary: If true, the Run method will invoke StartAcquire and CompleteAcquire on the operator in semi trigger mode. If false, only CompleteAcquire will be invoked.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqFifoTool.Run

event.para: Fires before the tool runs.

Fires when the tool runs. If the run was successful, results are generated; if the run was not successful, no results are generated and the previous results are cleared. Use after returns or in a event handler to determine whether a run was successful or unsuccessful.
The following state flags may be affected:
Fires after the tool runs.

member.summary: Runs the tool using the current parameter settings.

remarks.PARA: Performs the tool's primary function.

member.summary: Class that reads a CAD file to obtain collections of shapes by using the GetShape... methods, which optionally can connect open shapes into longer contours. A file must be open before using these methods. All splines will be approximated.

remarks.PARA: Primary interface of CogCADFile.

remarks.PARA: Name of the current open file. If there is no open file, it will return an empty string.

member.summary: Name of the current open file. If there is no open file, it will return an empty string.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCADFile.SplineApproximationSpacing

exception.para: A value less than or equal to 0 was supplied.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: All splines in the CAD file will be approximated. Sample points are computed along the spline such that the arc lengths between adjacent sample points do not exceed this spacing. This value is specified in the units of the CAD file's coordinate system.

member.summary: All splines in the CAD file will be approximated. Sample points are computed along the spline such that the arc lengths between adjacent sample points do not exceed this spacing. This spacing value is in the the same units as the CAD file.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCADFile.SplineApproximationTolerance

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

exception.para: A value less than or equal to 0 was supplied.

member.summary: All splines in the CAD file will be approximated. Sample points along the spline are guaranteed to be no further than this tolerance from the actual shape. This tolerance value is in the same units as the CAD file.

remarks.PARA: All splines in the CAD file will be approximated. Sample points along the spline are guaranteed to be no further than this tolerance from the actual shape. This value is specified in the units of the CAD file's coordinate system.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCADFile.SelectedSpaceName

remarks.PARA: Returns/sets the name of the coordinate space for this class, which will be applied to the shapes extracted from the CAD file. The SelectedSpaceName of each extracted shape will be set to the value of this property.

exception.para: An invalid selected space name was supplied.

member.summary: Returns/sets the name of the coordinate space for this class, which will be applied to the shapes extracted from the CAD file. The SelectedSpaceName of each extracted shape will be copied from this property.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCADFile.ConnectTolerance

remarks.PARA: Two open contour shapes are connected if the distance between two of their endpoints is less than this tolerance. Only used if is True. This value is specified in the units of the CAD file's coordinate system.

member.summary: Two open contour shapes are connectable if the distance between two of their endpoints is less than this tolerance. Only used if ConnectEnabled is True. This tolerance value is in the same units as the CAD file.

exception.para: A value less than or equal to zero was supplied.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCADFile.ConnectEnabled
member.summary: If true, it will try to connect open shapes into longer contours which are better for synthetic PatMax. Shapes are connected when the user calls the GetShape... methods. ConnectTolerance is used to control how near shapes must be to be connected.

remarks.PARA: If true, it will try to connect open shapes into longer contours which are better for synthetic PatMax. Shapes are connected when the user calls the methods. is used to control how near shapes must be to each other to be connected.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircle.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircle.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircle.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularAnnulusSection
member.summary: A circular annulus section is a four-sided shape bounded by two circular arcs and two radial lines. The arcs are scaled copies of each other. You specify the 'start' arc and then provide a RadialScale that defines the 'end' arc.

remarks.PARA: A circular annulus section is a four-sided shape bounded by two circular arcs and two radial lines. The arcs are scaled copies of each other, and the radial lines connect the endpoints of the arcs.
You specify the (,), , and which define the start arc and then provide a that defines the end arc. If the is less than 1, the start arc is the outer arc.
The following picture shows the parts of the circular annulus section and the interactive handles available when is set to All. The handle names are in italics.

CELL.PARA: Section span
Lets you change the length of the arc along the underlying circle. The center and radius do not change.
Endpoint
Lets you change location of either endpoint. Changing an endpoint can cause changes to all of the other circular annulus section parameters except the other endpoint.
Radii

Lets you change the radii of either the inner or outer arc. Changing the radii also changes the but not the center, start angle, or span. If you move the outer arc inside the inner arc or vice versa, the radial direction changes.
Bend
Lets you change the curvature of the circular annulus section. Changing the curvature can change all of the other circular annulus section parameters except the endpoints.

member.summary: Returns the perimeter length of this circular annulus section.

member.summary: Returns the area enclosed by this circular annulus section.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularAnnulusSection.RadialScale

remarks.PARA: Sets of gets the radial scale of this annulus section.

The radial scale determines the relative sizes of the two arcs that make up the annulus section. The two arcs are scaled copies of each other. The start arc is specified by setting the and properties. The end arc is specified by applying a radial scale to the start arc.
determines which arc is the inner arc and which arc is the outer arc. It also implies a radial direction as shown in the following table.
cannot be exactly 1.0, nor can it be less than or equal to zero.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.summary: Returns/sets the radial scale of this annular section. Note that this can be less than or greater than 1 (but not equal to 1, and not <=0) and therefore implies a radial direction.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularAnnulusSection.AngleSpan

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.summary: Returns/sets the angle span (in radians) of this annulus section. Note that this can be positive or negative, and implies arc direction.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the angle span of the start arc of this circular annulus section in radians. The angle can be any positive or negative value, but not exactly 0; the sign determines the direction of the arc.
If the absolute value of the angle span is greater than 2π, the arc wraps around on itself. It is not normalized to the range −2π to 2π
For example, an of +π is an arc that describes half of a full circle, and a span of −π describes the other half in the opposite direction.
To simply reverse the direction of an arc, you can use the following:

member.summary: Returns/sets the starting angle (in radians) of this annulus section.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the start angle of this annulus section. The angle is measured in radians from the x-axis.
is normalized to a value between +π and −π.

member.summary: Returns/sets the Radius of the start arc of this annulus section. Note this could be either the inner arc or the outer arc depending on whether RadialScale is greater than or less than 1.0.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the radius of the start arc of this annulus section. If is less than 1, the radius is from the center to the outer arc; if it is greater than 1, the radius is from the center to the inner arc.

member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularAnnulusSection.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

is called.

The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularAnnulusSection.CreateCircularArc(System.Double,Cognex.VisionPro.CogCopyShapeConstants)

param.name: radialFraction
param.PARA: Specifies the arc in relation to the section. Specify zero for the start arc, 0.5 for the center arc, and 1.0 for the end arc, or other values for intermediate arcs.

param.name: copyFlags
param.PARA: Specify which attributes of the shape to copy to the new shape.

Although you can specify values less than zero or greater than 1, this function will return an error if the resulting radius would be less than or equal to zero.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc
member.summary: A circular arc is a portion of a circle. You specify this shape using the usual circle parameters and two more: AngleStart and AngleSpan. AngleStart defines the angle at which the arc begins and AngleSpan defines the angular extent of the arc.

remarks.PARA: A circular arc is a portion of a circle. You specify this shape using the usual circle parameters and two additional ones: , the angle at which the arc begins, and , the angular extent of the arc.
The following picture shows the parts of the circular arc and the interactive handles available when is set to All. The handle names are in italics.

CELL.PARA: Arc span
Lets you change the length of the arc along the underlying circle. The center and radius do not change.
Endpoint
Lets you change location of either endpoint. Changing an endpoint can cause changes to all of the other circular arc parameters except the other endpoint.
Bend
Lets you change the curvature of the circular arc. Changing the curvature can change all of the other circular arc parameters except the endpoints.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.DisplayedRadiusInScreenPixels

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the radius in screen pixels that the arc is drawn with when is Screen
All of the geometric functions in use only to compute their results. This property only affects how the shape is rendered.

member.summary: Returns/sets the screen radius the arc will be drawn with if DisplayMode is cogCircularArcDisplayModeScreen.

event.para: Fires when the adornment changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.DisplayMode

event.para: Fires when the adornment changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Returns/sets the mode in which the arc will be displayed, either with the screen radius (DisplayedRadiusInScreenPixels) or the normal geometric radius (Radius).

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets whether the arc is drawn using the geometric radius or constant screen pixels.
When is Mathematical, VisionPro draws the arc as a geometric shape with the radius .
When is Screen, VisionPro uses the radius to draw the arc. In this mode, the displayed size of the arc is constant regardless of the zoom level set in the .
The mode affects only the way that the arc is displayed. Changing the mode does not change any of the geometric properties of the arc such as its .

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.ArcLength
member.summary: Returns the length of this circular arc.

remarks.PARA:
Returns the length of this circular arc.
As becomes greater than 2π, the length continues to increase. This value is always positive.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.AngleSpan
member.summary: Returns/sets the angle span (in radians) of this circular arc. Note that this can be positive or negative (but not exactly 0), and implies an arc direction.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the angle span of this circular arc in radians. The angle can be any positive or negative value, but not exactly 0; the sign determines the direction of the arc.
If the absolute value of the angle span is greater than 2π, the arc wraps around on itself. It is not normalized to the range −2π to 2π
For example, an of +π is an arc that describes half of a full circle, and a span of −π describes the other half in the opposite direction.
To simply reverse the direction of an arc, you can use the following:

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the start angle of this circular arc. The angle is measured in radians from the x-axis.
is normalized to a value between +π and −π.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCircularArc.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShape.CompositionMode

event.para: Fires when the composition mode changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Controls how this shape composes itself from its sub-shapes. Uniform mode propagates all composite graphic properties to sub shapes, making them act as if they were all one graphic. Freeform mode does not.

remarks.PARA: Controls how this shape composes itself from its child shapes. Uniform propagates all of the composite shape's graphic properties to the child shapes so that they behave as if they were a single graphic. Freeform allows each shape in the composite shape to be manipulated according to its own graphic properties.
The and properties are never propagated from the composite shape to the child shapes.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShape.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShape.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShape.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShape.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShape.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.Transform
member.summary: The CogCoordinateAxes will modify this transform to reflect its internal properties.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets a transformation object that correspond with this . If getting a transformation object, the transformation object returned corresponds to the current state of the coordinate axes. If setting a transformation object, the coordinate axes change to reflect the transformation object.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.param: Should be set to true when called from your public Dispose() method, thus disposing of all managed and unmanaged resources. It should be set to false when called from your Finalizer, thus disposing of only unmanaged resources.
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this class instance. Only derived classes that implement Dispose should call this method; Other clients who wish to explicitly release resources should call IDisposable.Dispose. Do not attempt to access an object after it has been disposed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.Clone
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of this class instance. Derived classes that implement Clone should override this method; other clients who wish to clone this instance should call ICloneable.Clone. See also CogSerializer.DeepCopyObject

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateAxes.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStatistics

remarks.PARA: This interface provides functions and properties that let you compute statistical measures of a set of data, where the individual data values are supplied in sequence.
This interface is very similar to . Unlike that interface, which can only be used as part of a CogDataAnalysis tool, is intended for stand-alone use.

member.summary: The object that buffers consecutive values in order to compute statistics and produce a tolerance result. It is meant to be used stand-alone and not in conjunction with the CogDataAnalysisTool.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStatistics.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogDataAnalysis.IndividualResultsEnabled
member.summary: Returns/sets the flag that controls whether individual result objects are added to the Results collection by Execute. If set to false, the Results collection will only hold the aggregate results.

remarks.PARA: If true, then an item is generated for each channel as part of the results collection. If false, only the aggregate value (Pass, Warn, or Fail) is stored.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogDataAnalysis.RejectOnInvalidData
member.summary: Returns/sets a flag that causes any invalid data values to produce a reject AggregateToleranceStatus if set to true. If set to false, this designates that those channels will not be used to compute the aggregate tolerance status.

remarks.PARA: If true, then if any channels have not been updated with new data since the tool's last run, the tool will produce a Reject value for the . If false, then channels with invalid data will not be used to compute the aggregate tolerance status.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogDataAnalysis.NumBufferedValues

member.summary: Returns the number of values stored in the buffer for each ICogDataAnalysisChannel item. This includes any invalid values that may have been buffered. NumBufferedValues will always be less than or equal to the ChannelBufferLength.

remarks.PARA: The number of values to buffer for each data analysis channel. The of each object will be buffered for each call to or .
Defining a buffer length lets you compute statistics for a specific number of samples (the buffer length) and for all of the samples.

member.summary: Returns TRUE if the AggregateToleranceStatus rejected.

remarks.PARA: True if is Reject, false otherwise. When this property is true, one or more of the s are outside the reject tolerances specified in their s (or one ore more values are invalid and is set to true).

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogDataAnalysisResults.AggregateWarn
member.summary: Returns TRUE if the AggregateToleranceStatus warned.

remarks.PARA: True if is Warn, false otherwise. When this property is true, one or more of the s are outside the warning tolerances specified in their s but none of them are outside of the reject tolerances.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogDataAnalysisResults.AggregatePass
member.summary: Returns TRUE if the AggregateToleranceStatus passed.

remarks.PARA: True if is Pass, false otherwise. When this property is true, if all of the s are within the tolerances specified in their s.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogDataAnalysisResults.AggregateToleranceStatus
member.summary: Returns the result of the specified tolerance limits applied across all ICogDataAnalysisChannel items.

remarks.PARA: The tolerance status computed by aggregating the individual statuses of all the s defined for this object.

If this value is Pass, then all the values are within tolerance limits; if this value is Warn, then one or more values are outside of their warning limits but no values are outside of the reject limit; and if this value is Reject, then one or more values are outside of their reject limits or one or more values are invalid and is set to true.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipse
member.summary: Class that represents an ellipse.

remarks.PARA: Interface that describes an ellipse shape. You specify an ellipse with a center point, a rotation from the shape's x-axis that establishes the ellipse's x- and y-axes, a radius along the x-axis, and a radius along the y-axis.
The following picture shows the parts of the ellipse and the interactive handles available when is set to All.

CELL.PARA: Radii
Let you change the x- and y-radii.
Rotation
Lets you change the rotation of the ellipse which is used to establish the shape's x- and y-axes.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the rotation angle, in radians, of this ellipse. The angle is measured from the x-axis of the selected coordinate space to the rotated x-axis of the ellipse. To find the rotation from the x-axis of the selected space name to the y-axis of the ellipse, add π/2 to this property.
Rotation values are normalized to be between −π and +π.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipse.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection

remarks.PARA: An elliptical annulus section is a four-sided shape bounded by two elliptical arcs and two straight lines. The arcs are scaled copies of each other, and the radial lines connect the endpoints of the arcs. You specify the (,), , , , and which define the start arc and then provide a that defines the end arc. If the is less than 1, the start arc is the outer arc.
The following picture shows the parts of the elliptical annulus section and the interactive handles available when is set to All. The handle names are in italics.

CELL.PARA: Section span
Lets you change the length of the arc along the underlying ellipse. The center, radii, and rotation do not change.
Endpoint
Lets you change location of either endpoint. Changing an endpoint can cause changes to all of the other elliptical annulus section parameters except the other endpoint.
Radii

Lets you change the radii of either the inner or outer arc. Changing the radii also changes the but not the center, rotation, start angle, or span. If you move the outer arc inside the inner arc or vice versa, the radial direction changes.
Bend
Lets you change the curvature of the elliptical annulus section. Changing the curvature can change all of the other elliptical annulus section parameters except the endpoints.
Constrained span

Lets you change the curvature of the elliptical annulus section by holding the endpoints and the Bend handle constant. As this handle rotates around the Bend handle, the underlying ellipse changes so that the annulus section spans a fraction of the ellipse.

When this handle is 0° relative to the Bend handle (directly to the right in the default coordinate system) the underlying ellipse grows quite large and flat so that the annulus section spans about 10% of the ellipse. When the handle is 180° from the Bend handle (directly to its left in the default coordinate system), the underlying ellipse becomes smaller so that the annulus section spans 50% of the ellipse.

member.summary: An elliptical annulus section is a four-sided shape bounded by two elliptical arcs and two straight lines. The arcs are scaled copies of each other. You specify the 'start' arc and then provide a RadialScale that defines the 'end' arc.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.Perimeter

remarks.PARA: Returns the total perimeter length of this elliptical annulus section. As becomes greater than 2π, the length continues to increase. This value is always positive.

member.summary: Returns the total perimeter length of this elliptical annulus section.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.Area

remarks.PARA: Returns the area enclosed by this elliptical annulus section.
If is greater than 2π, the area is the same as if were only 2π. This value is always positive.

member.summary: Returns the area enclosed by this elliptical annulus section.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.RadialScale
member.summary: Returns/sets the radial scaling factor. The elliptical annulus section contains a 'start' arc, and an 'end' arc that is a scaled copy of it. If RadialScale is greater than 1 the end arc will be larger than the start arc, otherwise it will be smaller.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets of gets the radial scale of this annulus section.

The radial scale determines the relative sizes of the two arcs that make up the annulus section. The two arcs are scaled copies of each other. The start arc is specified by setting the and properties. The end arc is specified by applying a radial scale to the start arc.
determines which arc is the inner arc and which arc is the outer arc. It also implies a radial direction as shown in the following table.
cannot be exactly 1.0, nor can it be less than or equal to zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.AngleSpan

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the angle span of the start arc of this elliptical annulus section in radians. The angle can be any positive or negative value, but not exactly 0; the sign determines the direction of the arc.
If the absolute value of the angle span is greater than 2π, the arc wraps around on itself. It is not normalized to the range −2π to 2π
For example, an of +π is an arc that describes half of a full ellipse, and a span of −π describes the other half in the opposite direction.
To simply reverse the direction of an arc, you can use the following:

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.summary: Returns/sets the angular extent (in radians) and direction of the annulus section. For example, a value of Pi specifies a section that is one half of the full annulus. A value of -Pi specifies the other half.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.AngleStart
member.summary: Returns/sets the angle (in radians) that specifies the start end of the annulus section. It is measured from the x-axis of the underlying ellipse.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the start angle of the annulus section. The angle is measured in radians from the x-axis of the underlying ellipse.
is normalized to a value between +π and −π.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.Rotation

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the rotation angle, in radians, of the underlying ellipse. The angle is measured from the x-axis of the selected coordinate space to the rotated x-axis of the ellipse. To find the rotation from the x-axis of the selected space name to the y-axis of the ellipse, add π/2 to this property.
Rotation values are normalized to be between −π and +π.

member.summary: Returns/sets the rotation angle (in radians) from the x-axis of the selected coordinate space to the x-axis of the ellipse.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.RadiusY
member.summary: Returns/sets the distance from the center of the start ellipse to its boundary (along the ellipse's y-axis). Note that the start ellipse will be the inner ellipse if RadialScale is greater than one, otherwise it will be the outer one.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the distance from the center of the underlying start ellipse to its boundary along the ellipse's y-axis. If is greater than 1, the start ellipse is the inner ellipse, otherwise it is the outer ellipse.
The y-axis may be rotated.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.GetUnitCircleParams(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DLinear@)

param.name: unitCircleAngleStart
param.PARA: The start angle of the unit circle arc in radians.

param.name: unitCircleAngleSpan
param.PARA: The span of the unit circle arc in radians.

param.name: radialScale
param.PARA: The of the unit circle's circular annulus section.

param.name: ellipseFromUnitCircle
param.PARA: The transform that maps the unit circle circular annulus section to this elliptical annulus section.

remarks.PARA: Gets a description of this elliptical annulus section as a unit circular arc, a linear transform that maps it to an elliptical arc, and a radial scale. The unit circle arc is centered at (0,0), has a radius of one, and has the provided start angle and span measured in radians.
Typically, the value is not the same as , and the is not the same as . The returned is normalized to be between +π and −π, but is not.
The child space of this shape is unit circle space. In the unit circle child space, you can pick (x,y) positions along the start arc using standard parametric equations for x and y:
x = cos(t) and y = sin(t)
where the angle t varies from and ( + ). To get points along the end arc, scale by .
You can map positions and angles in child space to the parent space using the transform. You can map from parent space to child space using the inverse transform.
Remember that is measured from the x-axis of the ellipse. You must add to to get the correct angle in parent space.

member.summary: Get a description of this annulus section as a unit circular arc, a linear transform that maps it to an elliptical arc, and RadialScale. The unit circle arc is centered at (0,0), has a radius of one, and has the given start angle and span (in radians).

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalAnnulusSection.CreateEllipticalArc(System.Double,Cognex.VisionPro.CogCopyShapeConstants)

param.name: radialFraction
param.PARA: Specifies the arc in relation to the section. Specify zero for the start arc, 0.5 for the center arc, and 1.0 for the end arc, or other values for intermediate arcs.

param.name: copyFlags
param.PARA: Specify which attributes of the shape to copy to the new shape.

remarks.PARA: Creates a new based on this elliptical annulus section as defined by the radial fraction between the start and end arcs. Specify zero for the start arc, 0.5 for the center arc, and 1.0 for the end arc. specifies which aspects of the arc are copied to the new shape.
Although you can specify values less than zero or greater than 1, this function will return an error if the resulting radii would be less than or equal to zero.

member.summary: Create a new elliptical arc (copying the specified parameters) from this annulus section. The arc is specified as a radial fraction between the start and end arcs. For example, specify 0 for the start arc, 0.5 for the center arc, and 1 for the end arc.
