member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc
member.summary: An elliptical arc is a portion of an ellipse. You specify this shape using the usual ellipse parameters and two more: AngleStart and AngleSpan. AngleStart defines the angle at which the arc begins and AngleSpan defines the angular extent of the arc.

remarks.PARA: An elliptical arc is a portion of an ellipse. You specify this shape using the usual ellipse parameters and two more: , the angle at which the arc begins, and , the angular extent of the arc.
The following picture shows the parts of the elliptical arc and the interactive handles available when is set to All. The handle names are in italics.

CELL.PARA: Arc span
Lets you change the length of the arc along the underlying ellipse. The center, radii, and rotation do not change.
Endpoint
Lets you change location of either endpoint. Changing an endpoint can cause changes to all of the other elliptical arc parameters except the other endpoint.
Bend
Lets you change the curvature of the elliptical arc. Changing the curvature can change all of the other elliptical arc parameters except the endpoints.
Constrained span

Lets you change the curvature of the elliptical arc by holding the endpoints and the Bend handle constant. As this handle rotates around the Bend handle, the underlying ellipse changes so that the arc spans a fraction of the ellipse.

When this handle is 0° relative to the Bend handle (directly to the right in the default coordinate system) the underlying ellipse grows quite large and flat so that the arc spans about 10% of the ellipse. When the handle is 180° from the Bend handle (directly to its left in the default coordinate system), the underlying ellipse becomes smaller so that the arc spans 50% of the ellipse.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.ArcLength

remarks.PARA:
Returns the length of this arc.
As becomes greater than 2π, the length continues to increase. This value is always positive.

member.summary: Returns the total length of this arc.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.AngleSpan

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the angle span of this elliptical arc in radians. The angle can be any positive or negative value, but not exactly 0; the sign determines the direction of the arc.
If the absolute value of the angle span is greater than 2π, the arc wraps around on itself. It is not normalized to the range −2π to 2π
For example, an of +π is an arc that describes half of a full ellipse, and a span of −π describes the other half in the opposite direction.
To simply reverse the direction of an arc, you can use the following:

member.summary: Returns/sets the angular extent (in radians) and direction of the arc. For example, a value of Pi specifies an arc that is one half of the full ellipse. A value of -Pi specifies the other half.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.AngleStart

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the start angle of the arc. The angle is measured in radians from the x-axis of the underlying ellipse.
is normalized to a value between +π and −π.

member.summary: Returns/sets the angle (in radians) that specifies the start of the arc. It is measured from the x-axis of the underlying ellipse.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.Rotation
member.summary: Returns/sets the rotation angle (in radians) from the x-axis of the selected coordinate space to the x-axis of the ellipse.

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the rotation angle, in radians, of the underlying ellipse. The angle is measured from the x-axis of the selected coordinate space to the rotated x-axis of the ellipse. To find the rotation from the x-axis of the selected space name to the y-axis of the ellipse, add π/2 to this property.
Rotation values are normalized to be between −π and +π.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogEllipticalArc.GetUnitCircleParams(System.Double@,System.Double@,Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DLinear@)

param.name: unitCircleAngleStart
param.PARA: The start angle of the unit circle arc in radians.

param.name: unitCircleAngleSpan
param.PARA: The span of the unit circle arc in radians.

param.name: ellipseFromUnitCircle
param.PARA: The transform that maps the unit circle arc to this elliptical arc.

member.summary: Get a description of this elliptical arc as a unit circular arc and a linear transform that maps it to an elliptical arc. The unit circle arc is centered at (0,0), has a radius of one, and has the provided start angle and span (in radians).

remarks.PARA: Gets a description of this elliptical arc as a unit circular arc and a linear transform that maps it to an elliptical arc. The unit circle arc is centered at (0,0), has a radius of one, and has the provided start angle and span measured in radians.
Typically, the value is not the same as , and the is not the same as . The returned is normalized to be between +π and −π, but is not.
The child space of this shape is unit circle space. In the unit circle child space, you can pick (x,y) positions along the arc using standard parametric equations for x and y:
x = cos(t) and y = sin(t)
where the angle t varies from and ( + ).
You can map positions and angles in child space to the parent space using the transform. You can map from parent space to child space using the inverse transform.
Remember that is measured from the x-axis of the ellipse. You must add to to get the correct angle in parent space.

remarks.PARA: Sets the geometry of this elliptical arc from the given description of a unit circular arc and the linear transform that maps it to an elliptical arc. The unit circle arc is centered at (0,0), has a radius of one, and has the specified start angle and span measured in radians.
Typically, the value is not the same as , and the is not the same as . The returned is normalized to be between +π and −π, but is not.
The child space of this shape is unit circle space. In the unit circle child space, you can pick (x,y) positions along the arc using standard parametric equations for x and y:
x = cos(t) and y = sin(t)
where the angle t varies from and ( + ).
You can map positions and angles in child space to the parent space using the transform. You can map from parent space to child space using the inverse transform.
Remember that is measured from the x-axis of the ellipse. You must add to to get the correct angle in parent space.

event.para: Fires when the shape changes.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogFitCircle.RadiusConstraint

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: The value that the radius of the circle will be constrained to if radius is constrained.

remarks.PARA: If is true, then the radius of the circle being fit will be constrained to the value of this property. The radius is expressed in the selected space supplied to the command.

exception.para: The supplied value is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogFitCircle.RadiusConstraintEnabled

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Whether radius will be constrained for the fit.

remarks.PARA: If this property is true, the radius of the circle being fit will have its radius constrained to .

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogFitCircle.NumToIgnore

event.para: Fires when the value of this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

exception.para: The supplied value is less than zero.

remarks.PARA: The number of points that will be ignored in the fitting operation. The fitting tool considers each possible combination of minus points. If you specify large values for both the number of points to consider and the number of points to ignore, the fitting operation can take a great deal of time to complete.

member.summary: The number of points that will be ignored in the fitting operation.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogFitCircle.NumPoints
member.summary: The number of points that will be considered for the fit.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

remarks.PARA: The number of points that will be considered for the fit. If you increase the value of , the newly added points are set to (0, 0) and placed at the end of the list. If you decrease the value of , points are removed from the end of the list.

exception.para: The supplied value is less than zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogFitLine.NumToIgnore

remarks.PARA: The number of points that will be ignored in the fitting operation. The fitting tool considers each possible combination of minus points. If you specify large values for both the number of points to consider and the number of points to ignore, the fitting operation can take a great deal of time to complete.

exception.para: The supplied value is less than zero.

member.summary: The number of points that will be ignored in the fitting operation.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogFitLine.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogFitLineTool.Run

event.para: Fires before the tool runs.

Fires when the tool runs. If the run was successful, results are generated; if the run was not successful, no results are generated and the previous results are cleared. Use after returns or in a event handler to determine whether a run was successful or unsuccessful.
The following state flags may be affected:
Fires on an unsuccessful run. No results are generated and no previous results exist.
The following state flag may be affected:
Fires after the tool runs.

member.summary: Runs the tool using the current parameter settings.

remarks.PARA: Fits the points defined in and returns the result of the fit operation in .
remarks.NOTE: This method does not actually raise the exceptions listed below. Use the property to obtain a reference. Then use its property to see if the Run method raised any exceptions.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContour
member.summary: A general contour is a shape made up of a series of directed line and arc segments followed in order to go from 'start' to 'end' of the contour. You build the shape by adding segments, giving the geometry and start/end connectivity of each one.

remarks.PARA: A general contour is a shape made up of a series of directed line and arc segments followed in order to go from the start to the end of the contour. You build the shape by adding segments, giving the geometry and start point and end point connectivity of each one.
For information about manipulating a general contour interactively, see the discussion of general contour shape models.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContour.Closed

remarks.PARA: Returns True if the contour contains a single, connected, closed chain of segments. If the contour has no segments, or if the contour is not closed, returns False.

member.summary: True if the contour contains a single connected chain of segments that is closed, otherwise False.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContour.Length
member.summary: Computes the sum of the lengths of all segments of the contour.

remarks.PARA: Computes the sum of the lengths of all segments of the contour. If there are no segments in the contour, returns zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContour.DirectionAdornment
member.summary: Returns/sets the adornment used to indicate the direction of the contour.

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the adornment used to indicate the direction of the contour.

For very small segments (less than 16 display pixels), the direction adornment is not drawn even if enabled. For small segments (less than 32 screen pixels), the direction adornment appears near the midpoint of the segment. For all other segments, direction adornments appear near the 25% and 75% fraction of the segment.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContour.VertexAdornment

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the adornment drawn at the vertices of the contour.
You can set the color of each vertex adornment by defining a and then using the and .

member.summary: Returns/sets the adornment drawn at the vertices of the contour.

member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContour.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

remarks.PARA:

is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.

The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.

member.summary: Adds a new line segment before NextSegment. If NextSegment is Nothing, the new segment is added at the end of the contour. If StartFlags has the 'connected' bit set, then StartX and StartY are ignored. This also applies to EndFlags.

event.para: Fires when the segment is added.

member.EVENT: Index Fires when the segment is added. This event fires in addition to the change event.

remarks.PARA: Adds a new line segment with the specified start and end points before . The and specify how the end points of the line segment are connected to the rest of the contour shape. After adding the new line segment, all positioned at or after are updated so that they continue to refer to the same segment as before calling .

If is Nothing, the new segment is added at the end of the contour, so cannot include Connected. If is the first segment, the new segment is added at the beginning of the contour, so cannot include Connected
If includes Connected, then and are ignored. Similarly, if includes Connected, then and are ignored.
remarks.NOTE: never breaks connections or closure, and it never modifies the coordinates of segments that exist before the call. In particular, this means that new segments cannot be added between two segments that are already connected.

param.name: nextSegment
param.PARA: The segment that follows the new segment. If this value is Nothing, the new segment is added at the end of the contour shape.

param.name: startX
param.PARA: X-coordinate of the start point of the segment. Ignored if includes Connected.

param.PARA: Y-coordinate of the start point of the segment. Ignored if includes Connected.

param.PARA: Y-coordinate of the end point of the segment. Ignored if includes Connected.

param.name: ellipseFraction
param.PARA: The fraction of the ellipse that passes through the start, mid-, and end points. For slight arcs, using roughly a quarter of the ellipse usually provides good results. This value must be greater than 0 and less than 1

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogImage24PlanarColor.Get24PlanarColorPixelMemory(Cognex.VisionPro.CogImageDataModeConstants,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage8PixelMemory@,Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage8PixelMemory@,Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage8PixelMemory@)

param.name: dataMode
param.PARA: Specifies whether the pixel data are read, write, or read/write.

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate of the portion of the image to get.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate of the portion of the image to get.

param.name: width
param.PARA: The width of the image to get.

param.name: height
param.PARA: The height of the image to get.

param.name: pixelMemory0
param.PARA: An object that represents the pixel data for the first plane.

param.name: pixelMemory1
param.PARA: An object that represents the pixel data for the second plane.

param.name: pixelMemory2
param.PARA: An object that represents the pixel data for the third plane.

remarks.PARA:
Gets an object for each plane of this image. The returned objects can be used to access pixel memory directly. You must call each object's
method when you are finished with it.
The , , , and parameters let you specify the portion of the image to get. To access the pixel memory for the entire image, specify zero for these parameters.

If you request read/write or write-only access to the pixel memory when you call , the pixel memory may be copied internally. Any changes that you make to the pixel may not be written back to the image until you call . Your application should assume that no changes to the image take place until then.

member.summary: Get objects that can be used to directly access each plane of pixel memory. The caller MUST call Dispose on each of these objects when finished with them.

exception.para: , , , and describe a region that is not entirely within the image.

member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogImage8Grey.Get8GreyPixelMemory(Cognex.VisionPro.CogImageDataModeConstants,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

param.name: dataMode
param.PARA: Specifies whether the pixel data are read, write, or read/write.

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate of the portion of the image to get.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate of the portion of the image to get.

param.name: width
param.PARA: The width of the image to get.

param.name: height
param.PARA: The height of the image to get.

member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to directly access pixel memory. The caller MUST call Dispose on this object when finished with it.

exception.para: , , , and describe a region that is not entirely within the image.

returns.PARA: An object that represents the pixel data.

remarks.PARA:
Gets an object that can be used to access pixel memory directly. You must call this object's
method when you are finished with it.
The , , , and parameters let you specify the portion of the image to get. To access the pixel memory for the entire image, specify zero for these parameters.

If you request read/write or write-only access to the pixel memory when you call , the pixel memory may be copied internally. Any changes that you make to the pixel may not be written back to the image until you call . Your application should assume that no changes to the image take place until then.

member.summary: Assign this CogSimpleColor object's value from the mean color value of the input image and Region.
member.exception: If an internal error occurs.
member.remarks: The color space of this CogSimpleColor will be the same as the input image's color space.
member.event: Fires when this method updates the color values.
member.exception: If is NULL.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogSimpleColor.UpdateUsingMeanColorFromImageRegion(Cognex.VisionPro.CogImage24PlanarColor,Cognex.VisionPro.ICogRegion,Cognex.VisionPro.CogImageColorSpaceConstants)
member.param: The image to analyze. May not be NULL.
An optional region. May be NULL. If supplied, limit the computation of mean color to only the pixels that fall within this region. If no region is supplied, the entire image is processed.
After calling this method, the ColorSpace property will have this value.
member.event: Fires when this method updates the color values.
member.summary: Set the values of this CogSimpleColor object to the mean color of the supplied input image. If a region is provided, limit analysis to the pixels within that region. The new values for this CogSimpleColor will be in the user specified color space.
member.exception: If an internal error occurs.
If is NULL.

member.value: The color plane type

member.summary: Gets whether the values on this color plane can wrap from 255 to 0.
member.value: True if the plane is hue plane in HSI color space; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPlaneRange.Nominal
member.summary: Gets the nominal value on this color plane.
member.value: The nominal value

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPlaneRange.Softness
member.value: The softness value
member.summary: Gets the softness value.
member.remarks: Low end position of the softness is Nominal + LowTolerance - Softness. High end position of the softness is Nominal + HighTolerance + Softness.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPlaneRange.HighTolerance
member.value: The high end tolerance value
member.remarks: High end of the range is specified as Nominal + HighTolerance.
member.summary: Gets the high end tolerance value.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPlaneRange.LowTolerance
member.value: The low end tolerance value
member.remarks: Low end of the range is specified as Nominal + LowTolerance.
member.summary: Gets the low end tolerance value.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPlaneRange.Update(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: The new nominal value for the range.
The new low end tolerance value for the range.
The new high end tolerance value for the range.
The new softness value for the range.
member.summary: Sets Nominal, Tolerance and Softness values.
member.remarks: If the plane is not hue plane, the range defined should be inside [0, 255]; If the plane is hue plane, the range defined can be in [-256, 255] or [0, 511] because of hue value wrapping.
member.exception: If is less than 0 or larger than 255.
member.event: Fires when this property changes.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPlaneRange.UpdateWithClipping(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: The new nominal value for the range.
The new low end tolerance value for the range.
The new high end tolerance value for the range.
The new softness value for the range.
member.event: Fires when this method updates Nominal, Tolerance or Softness values.
member.summary: Sets Nominal, Tolerance and Softness values and clip these values if they are out of range.
member.remarks: If the plane is not hue plane, the range defined should be inside [0, 255]; If the plane is hue plane, the range defined can be in [-256, 255] or [0, 511] because of hue value wrapping.

If , , , and
are all zero, then the entire image is converted. Otherwise, only the specified portion of the image is converted.

remarks.PARA: Returns the logical line number of the I/O line. Refer to your hardware documentation for the equivalence between logical line numbers and physical lines.

Some Cognex frame grabbers are available in several configurations which affect the relationship between logical line numbers and physical connections. These configurations are described in your frame grabber's hardware manual. VisionPro reads the I/O configuration from the VisionPro.ini in the Windows or WINNT directory. Make sure that the configuration described in this file matches your frame grabber.
See How to Use I/O Lines for a list of topics that describe the mappings for different frame grabbers.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogInputLine.CreateEventSink(System.String)

param.name: progIDOrClassID
param.PARA: A ProgID or ClassID that identifies the type of object to create.

remarks.PARA: Create an object in the event thread of this input line. This allows single-threaded objects to sink input line events efficiently.

This input line's event thread runs at a high priority, which means that the event handler you implement in the specified class will also run at a high priority. You should take care to limit the amount of processing time required to service events.

This function creates an object within the apartment of the input line's event thread but it does not actually connect the input line events to the object. In Visual Basic events are connected by assigning the input line to a WithEvents variable declared in the class that was created. For example if your event sink class (named ) contains the following code:
remarks.CODE:
Public WithEvents InputLine As CogInputLineEvents
Private Sub InputLine_LowToHigh(ByVal Overlap As Long) Run the inspection now End Sub
remarks.PARA: You would use the code shown below to create the event sink class and connect it to the input line event source when your program starts:
remarks.CODE:
Dim FGs As New CogFrameGrabbers, DiscreteIO As CogDiscreteIO Set DiscreteIO = FGs(0) Dim InputLine As CogInputLine Set InputLine = DiscreteIO.InputLines(0)
Dim Inspection As MyInspection Set Inspection = InputLine.CreateEventSink("MyProject.MyInspection") Set Inspection.InputLine = InputLine
remarks.NOTE: If you wish to use this function to implement true multithreading in a Visual Basic 6 application, the object specified by must be defined in an ActiveX DLL project.

member.summary: Create an object in the event thread of this input line. This allows single-threaded objects to sink input line events efficiently.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLine

remarks.PARA: Primary interface of a .
A CogLine is a line of infinite length specified by a reference point and a rotation. The rotation is specified from the x-axis.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLine.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLine.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLine.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLine.SetDistanceRotation(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: distance
param.PARA: The distance from the origin to the line.

param.name: rotation
param.PARA: The line's rotation, measured in radians from the x-axis.

remarks.PARA: Sets the reference point and rotation of the line based on a vector.

The reference point of the line is the end of the vector (, + 90°). If is negative, the reference point is the end of the vector (-, - 90°). is specified in radians and normalized to the range -π to π.
You can also interpret the line as if it were parallel to the x-axis of a coordinate frame that is rotated radians, and translated along the rotated y-axis by .
In the following figure, is 3 and is 45° (π/2 radians).
And in the following figure, is -3 and is 45° (π/2 radians).

member.summary: Sets the X and Y properties of this line to the end of the vector (Distance, Rotation + 90 deg.) or (-Distance, Rotation - 90 deg.) for negative Distance. Sets the Rotation property to the specified Rotation.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLineSegment.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLineSegment.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogLineSegment.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogMaskGraphic.SetTransparencyMap(System.Byte,Cognex.VisionPro.CogMaskGraphicTransparencyConstants)

param.name: maskVal
param.PARA: The mask pixel value.

event.para: Fires when the transparency value changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

exception.para: is not in the range 0 to 100.

member.summary: Controls transparency of mask values when displayed. The transparency value may be any integer between 0 (fully opaque) and 100 (fully transparent) inclusive.

remarks.PARA: Controls transparency of mask values when displayed.

The transparency value can be any integer in the range 0 to 100. If the transparency is set to 0 (None), then the mask value is drawn opaque in the color returned by calling ().
If the transparency value is 100 (Full), the mask value is completely transparent.
Values between 0 and 100 are color-blended between the color returned by calling (). and the color value at that location under the mask as dictated by graphic z-order.
The predefined transparency constants, None, Half, and Full provide best performance.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogMaximizer.Execute(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

param.name: lowLimit
param.PARA: The minimum input value to evaluate.

param.name: highLimit
param.PARA: The maximum input value to evaluate.

param.name: tolerance
param.PARA: When the maximized value can not be increased except by changing the input value by less than , this function returns.

remarks.PARA: Empirically determines the input value that maximizes a function's output value. This function works by firing the event. You supply a handler for this event that takes an input value and produces an output value; this function invokes that event handler repeatedly with a variety of input values until it determines which input value produces the maximum output value.

In addition to providing the event handler, you also supply this function with values for the and of the range of values to evaluate. You also provide a value that controls the granularity with which this function adjusts the input value.

If the function being maximized is strictly unimodal (has only one maximum) and has no plateaus, then the maximization algorithm will compute the true global maximum for the function. If these conditions are not met, then the algorithm may compute a local but not a global maximum.

A typical application for the maximizer function is automatically focusing a camera. You would specify the minimum and maximum focus positions as the and parameters, and your event handler would take the supplied focus position value, adjust the focus accordingly, acquire an image, use the Image Sharpness tool to compute its sharpness score and return the sharpness score. The maximizer would invoke your event handler repeatedly with a variety of focus position values until it determined the focus position that produced the highest image sharpness score.
remarks.NOTE: Keep in mind that if the combination of the image sharpness method you select and the specific image content you are evaluating does not produce a strictly unimodal image sharpness graph, then this function may not determine the focus position that produces the sharpest image.

member.EVENT: Fires repeatedly until maximum is located or is set to false.
member.summary: Executes the maximization algorithm by iteratively firing the Evaluate event to maximize the Fitness value. Tolerance must be greater than 0 and HighLimit-LowLimit must be less than 701408733.

returns.PARA:
The value, in the range from
through , that produced the highest value from the event handler that you implement.

exception.para: is less than or equal to .
is less than or equal to 0.
The event sink did not set to true.

member.name: E:Cognex.VisionPro.CogMaximizer.Evaluate
member.summary: Occurs when the Execute method of CogMaximizer is run. Each time it is fired, the handler for this event must compute a Fitness value that corresponds to the supplied Position value. The Execute method continues to fire this event until it has determined which input Position value produces the highest output Fitness value (or until the event handler terminates the Execute method prematurely, by failing to set the Continue parameter to true.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogOutputLine.Value

remarks.PARA: The value of this output line. True means that the output is in the TTL high state (for TTL lines) or the no-current-flowing state (for opto-isolated lines).
remarks.NOTE: When you get the value of this property, the value returned does not indicate the actual state of the line. Instead, it indicates the state that the software is attempting to set. An improper connection or hardware failure can cause the actual state of the output line to be different than the value returned by this property.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogOutputLine.LineNumber

remarks.PARA: Returns the logical line number of the I/O line. Refer to your hardware documentation for the equivalence between logical line numbers and physical lines.

Some Cognex frame grabbers are available in several configurations which affect the relationship between logical line numbers and physical connections. These configurations are described in your frame grabber's hardware manual. VisionPro reads the I/O configuration from the VisionPro.ini in the Windows or WINNT directory. Make sure that the configuration described in this file matches your frame grabber.
See How to Use I/O Lines for a list of topics that describe the mappings for different frame grabbers.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Area of the enclosed region, in units consistent with the SelectedSpaceName. Zero if there are fewer than 3 vertices.

remarks.PARA: Area of the region enclosed by the polygon, in units consistent with the . If there are fewer than three vertices, or if is True, the area is zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPolygon.Convex

remarks.PARA: True if the polygon is identical to the convex hull of its vertices, False otherwise. The convex hull of a polygon is the polygon that would result if you were to stretch a rubber band around the vertices.
A polygon with 0 or 1 vertex is convex.

member.summary: True if the polygon is identical to the convex hull of its vertices, otherwise False.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPolygon.Perimeter
member.summary: Perimeter of the polygon, in units consistent with the SelectedSpaceName. Zero if there are fewer than 2 vertices.

remarks.PARA: Perimeter of the polygon, in units consistent with the . The perimeter is the sum of the lengths of all of the segments including the closing the segment from the last vertex to the first vertex. If there are fewer than two vertices, the perimeter is zero.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRLEBuffer.GetRuns
member.summary: Gets a one dimensional array of CogRLERun objects for this CogRLEBuffer. The order of these CogRLERun objects is row major - that is, they start with the first image pixel row, progressing from the first pixel column towards the last pixel column, then continue with the second row, and so on. The end of each row is identified with a CogRLERun object whose Length value is zero.
member.returns: A one dimensional array of CogRLERun objects.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangleAffine

remarks.PARA: Interface that describes an affine rectangle.

An affine rectangle is a quadrilateral where the opposite sides are parallel. An affine rectangle can be specified by the locations of three of its vertices; by its center point, width, height, rotation, and skew angle; or by its origin point, width, height, rotation, and skew angle. The vertices of an affine rectangle are labeled as shown in the following figure:
Po is the Corner point origin.
Popp is the Corner point opposite.
Px is the Corner point X.
Py is the Corner point Y.
Note that the corner points Px and Py denote the points that lie along the x- and y-axes. Each of these points has its own x- and y-coordinates.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangleAffine.SuspendChangedEvent
member.summary: Temporarily suspends the raising of the Changed event. May be called more than once, and a corresponding call to ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent must be made for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangleAffine.ResumeAndRaiseChangedEvent
member.summary: Re-enables raising of the Changed event after SuspendChangedEvent has been called. Also raises the Changed event if the ChangedEventSuspended count is reduced to zero and any changes were made while events were suspended. Must be called once for each call to SuspendChangedEvent.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangleAffine.DistanceToPoint(System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: x
param.PARA: The x-coordinate to measure from.

param.name: y
param.PARA: The y-coordinate to measure from.

member.summary: Shortest distance from a boundary of this shape to the given point. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

returns.PARA: The distance from the point (, ) to the shape.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangleAffine.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangleAffine.FitToBoundingBox(Cognex.VisionPro.CogRectangle)

param.name: boundingRectangle
param.PARA: The rectangle that the shape is to fit into.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract

remarks.PARA: Primary interface of CogShapeExtract.

member.summary: The shape extraction operator is used to extract contours from an image. Each contour is converted into a shape model which describes the geometry of the contour as well as its polarity. A filtered and ranked collection of shape models is returned.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.MaxNumShapes

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: The maximum number of shapes that will be returned. Shapes that do not meet the closure, polarity, and perimeter constraints are filtered out first. If more than specified number of shapes remain after filtering, the lowest-ranked shapes are also discarded.

exception.para: The supplied value is less than or equal to 0.

member.summary: The maximum number of shapes that will be returned. Shapes that do not meet the closure, polarity, and perimeter constraints are filtered out first. If more than MaxNumShapes remain after filtering then the lowest-ranked shapes are also discarded.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.ProximityShape

remarks.PARA: Shape used for ranking extracted shapes when RankMode is cogShapeExtractRankModeProximity. Shapes are ranked based on their distance from this shape. Shapes closer to this proximity shape are ranked higher.
This parameter is ignored unless is Proximity.

member.summary: Shape used for ranking extracted shapes when RankMode is cogShapeExtractRankModeProximity. Shapes are ranked based on their distance from this shape. Shapes closer to this proximity shape are ranked higher.

exception.para: The supplied value is a or .

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.RankMode

exception.para: The supplied value is not a member of the enumeration.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Indicates the mode for ranking extracted shapes. The returned collection of shapes is sorted from highest rank to lowest. If more shapes than the maximum number requested are found then the lowest ranking shapes are discarded.

remarks.PARA: Indicates the mode for ranking extracted shapes. The returned collection of shapes is sorted from highest rank to lowest. If more shapes than the maximum number requested are found then the lowest ranking shapes are discarded.
remarks.NOTE: The shape rankings are computed from the raw image edge data, before they are converted into approximating shapes. For this reason, it is possible that the approximating shapes appear out of ranked order.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.PerimeterLimitMax
member.summary: The maximum allowed perimeter length of extracted shapes when PerimeterLimitsEnabled is true. The maximum perimeter length is specified in units of the selected space of the input image.

remarks.PARA: The maximum allowed perimeter length of extracted shapes when PerimeterLimitsEnabled is true. The maximum perimeter length is specified in units of the selected space of the input image.
must be less than or equal to . If one property changes such this relationship is not maintained, the other property is set equal to this one.
remarks.NOTE: The limit checking is performed after connect tolerance checking is performed but before the raw edges are converted into a shape. The perimeter limit is checked against the perimeter of a polyline with a vertex at each edge point. Under some conditions, the final approximated shape will have a perimeter outside of the specified limits.

exception.para: The supplied value is less than or equal to zero.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.

Fires when both this property and change.

must be greater than or equal to . If one property changes such this relationship is not maintained, the other property is set equal to this one.

member.summary: Specifies the desired polarity for extracting closed shapes. The polarity setting has no effect on the extraction of open shapes.

remarks.PARA: Indicates whether open and/or closed shapes should be extracted from the input image.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.

member.summary: Indicates whether open and/or closed shapes should be extracted from the input image.

exception.para: The supplied value is not a member of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.ConnectTolerance

exception.para: The supplied value is less than 0.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: If the distance between two endpoints of raw edge chains is less than this tolerance then the chains will be connected into a single chain. In the case that the two endpoints come from the same open chain, the chain is converted into a closed chain.
Polarity is ignored when forming connections. The polarity of a composite chain comprising multiple connected subchains is set to the polarity that exists over the majority of the composite contour.
remarks.NOTE: Specifying a value of zero disables the connecting of raw edge chains.

member.summary: If the distance between two endpoints of raw edge chains is less than this tolerance then the chains will be connected into a single chain. In the case that the two endpoints come from the same open chain, the chain is converted into a closed chain.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.Vocabulary

remarks.PARA: Indicates which primitive shapes that may be extracted. The shape vocabulary is an integer that is obtained by ORing together the vocabulary constants of the desired primitive shapes.

If both the circle and ellipse shapes are enabled, then will generate a circle whenever the raw edges can be fit to a circle within the specified . Similarly, if both the circular and elliptical arc shapes are enabled, will generate an elliptical arc with equal radii if the raw edges can be fit to a circular arc within the specified .

member.summary: Indicates which primitive shapes that may be extracted. The shape vocabulary is an integer that is obtained by ORing together the vocabulary constants of the desired primitive shapes.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.ApproximationTolerance

remarks.PARA: Specifies an upper bound on the deviation of the raw edge data from the approximating shape. Specified in selected space units of the input image supplied to . Higher tolerances result in less accurate but generally simpler shape representations.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

exception.para: The supplied value is less than or equal to 0.

member.summary: Specifies an upper bound on the deviation of the raw edge data from the approximating shape. Specified in selected space units of the input image. Higher tolerances result in larger approximations, but tend to produce simpler shape representations.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtract.ContrastThreshold

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

exception.para: The supplied value is less than 0.

member.summary: The minimum absolute contrast difference used when extracting raw edge data from the input image. Edges with a contrast difference that is less than or equal to this threshold are ignored.

remarks.PARA: The minimum absolute contrast difference used when extracting raw edge data from the input image. Edges with a contrast difference that is less than or equal to this threshold are ignored.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Indicates the mode that the shape polarization operator will use for combining the original shape polarities with the polarities derived from the image.

member.summary: Indicates the mode that the shape polarization operator will use for combining the original shape polarities with the polarities derived from the image.

exception.para: The supplied value is not a member of the enumeration.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapePolarize.MinPolarityPerimeter

remarks.PARA: The minimum length a constant-polarity section of the shape must have in order to be preserved. Sections that are shorter than this length will be combined with neighboring sections and the polarity will be set based on polarity of its neighbors.
A value of 0 will disable the combining of sections. A value greater than the longest perimeter of the original shape has the same effect as setting to true.
remarks.NOTE: This property is in the units of the selected space of the image being used for polarization.

member.summary: The minimum length a constant-polarity section of the shape must have in order to be preserved. Sections that are shorter than this length will be combined with neighboring sections and the polarity will be set based on polarity of its neighbors.

exception.para: The supplied value is less than 0.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapePolarize.MaintainShapeIntegrity

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: If true then the shape will not be broken up into sections due to differing polarities along the shape's boundary. In this case, the property is ignored. A primitive shape that is broken up into sections will become a .
If this property is true, then any shapes being polarized will be assigned a single polarity value. That is, all the segments of the contour will have the same polarity.

member.summary: If true then the shape will not be broken up into sections due to differing polarities along the shape's boundary. In this case, the MinPolarityPerimeter property is ignored. A primitive shape that is broken up into sections will become a contour.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapePolarize.ContrastThreshold

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: The minimum absolute contrast difference between a polarity sample point's probes that is required to make a polarity determination. If the difference is less than the threshold then the polarity sample point is assigned an undefined polarity.

remarks.PARA: The minimum absolute contrast difference between a polarity sample point's probes that is required to make a polarity determination. If the difference is less than the threshold then the polarity sample point is assigned an undefined polarity.

exception.para: The supplied value is less than 0.

remarks.PARA: A 2D transform object that can compose transforms of different types. The composed transform maps points through all its contained transformations (from 'Right' to 'Left'), acting as their composition even if the individual transformations are not mathematically composable.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DComposed.BestFitLinearTransform(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double@)

param.name: fromPoints
param.PARA: An array of points, expressed in From coordinates, for which to apply .

param.name: rmsError
param.PARA: If you supply a value for , sets it to the RMS error of the points against the returned linear transformation. A value of 0 indicates that the returned transformation exactly maps the points. Note that the RMS error is measured in To space.

is the Root Mean Square (RMS) unweighted Euclidian error between two sets of corresponding points. Set A is composed of the given points (in From space) after they have been mapped through this transform into To space. Set B is the same points after they have been mapped to To space using the linear transform returned by this function.

returns.PARA: A object that describes the best-fit linear transform (the one that produces the smallest RMSError of any linear transform).

exception.para: Too few points were provided to compute a best fit linear transform.

remarks.PARA: Returns a new linear transform that best describes this transform over the given set of points. These points must be expressed in From coordinates. The returned transform is called the "best-fit linear transform" because it is guaranteed to produce the smallest RMSError of any linear transform.

member.summary: Returns a new linear transform which best describes this transform over the given set of points. The points must be expressed in 'from' coordinates.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DComposed.ComposeBase(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogTransform2D)

param.name: rightSide
param.PARA: The transform object to compose with this one.

member.summary: Returns a new transform which is the composition of the given transform (on the right side) and this one (on the left side).

returns.PARA: An that represents the result of the composition.

remarks.PARA: Returns a new transform that is the composition of this transform and the specified transform.

This function performs the same operation as the method of . However, this method returns the transform of most suitable type based on the types of the transform objects being composed. For example, if you compose two linear transforms, the resulting transform is linear.

The order in which you compose transformations is important. If you have a transform that maps AFromB and another that maps BFromC, you compose the two to get a single transform that maps AFromC as follows: AFromB.ComposeBase(BFromC). You do not use: BFromC.ComposeBase(AFromB).

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DComposed.InvertBase
member.summary: Returns a new transform which is the inverse of this one.

remarks.PARA: Returns a transform that is the inverse of this transform. If a transform maps points from space A to space B, the inverse of the transform maps points from space B to space A.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DComposed.Canonize(System.Boolean)

param.name: typeSimplify
param.PARA: Specify False to force this function to return a transformation of type . If you specify True, then the returned transformation may be of a simpler type.

remarks.PARA: Returns the canonical form of this composed transform. This is the mathematically equivalent form that has the fewest number of transforms.
Canonization may include each of the following operations:

LIST.ITEM:
If this
contains other
transformations (effectively a tree of transformations where the non-leaf nodes are composed transformations), the Canonical form will flatten this tree by arranging all the leaf nodes linearly within the canonical form of the composed transformation.
Any adjacent transformations that are mathematically composable (such as objects) are composed.

If the effect of applying the preceding two operations is to produce a composed transformation that contains a single transformation, the Canonical form will be of that type (typically ). You can prevent this conversion by specifying False for the argument.

remarks.NOTE: This function returns a new transformation which is the canonical form of this object. It does not change the current object in any way.

event.para: Fires when the transformation is canonized.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.summary: Returns the canonical form of this composed transform. This is the mathematically equivalent form that has the fewest number of transforms. If TypeSimplify is True, the returned type may be reduced to a type simpler than this.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DLinear

remarks.PARA: represents a two-dimensional linear transformation between two coordinate spaces. It enables you to map points from the from coordinate space to the to coordinate space. It defaults to the identity transform.

represents a linear transformation as a (2x2) matrix and a translation vector. There are three different parameterization methods for the matrix, each based on the following general 2-d linear transformation:
Where (xA, yA) is the input point, (Tx, Ty) is the translation vector, and the rest is the (2x2) matrix that represents the scaling and rotation.

member.summary: Linear 2D coordinate transform.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DLinear.MatrixDeterminant
member.summary: Returns the determinant of the 2-by-2 matrix in this transformation.

remarks.PARA: Returns the determinant of this transformation object's 2x2 matrix. The determinant of a 2x2 matrix is computed as follows:

In VisionPro, you might use the to test for a degenerate transform: for example, the method is based on the determinant. You might also use the determinant to ascertain how a transform changes the handedness of the x- and y-axes: if the matrix determinant is negative, the transform swaps the handedness of the x- and y-axes. In other words, if the determinant is negative, the skew is greater than +90 or less than -90 degrees; if the determinant is positive, the skew is between +90 and -90 degrees.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DLinear.BestFitLinearTransform(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double@)

param.name: fromPoints
param.PARA: An array of points, expressed in From coordinates, for which to apply .

param.name: rmsError
param.PARA: If you supply a value for , sets it to the RMS error of the points against the returned linear transformation. A value of 0 indicates that the returned transformation exactly maps the points. Note that the RMS error is measured in To space.

is the Root Mean Square (RMS) unweighted Euclidian error between two sets of corresponding points. Set A is composed of the given points (in From space) after they have been mapped through this transform into To space. Set B is the same points after they have been mapped to To space using the linear transform returned by this function.

remarks.PARA: Returns a new linear transform that best describes this transform over the given set of points. These points must be expressed in From coordinates. The returned transform is called the "best-fit linear transform" because it is guaranteed to produce the smallest RMSError of any linear transform.

returns.PARA: A object that describes the best-fit linear transform (the one that produces the smallest RMSError of any linear transform).

exception.para: Too few points were provided to compute a best fit linear transform.

member.summary: Returns a new linear transform which best describes this transform over the given set of points. The points must be expressed in 'from' coordinates.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.CogTransform2DLinear.ComposeBase(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogTransform2D)

param.name: rightSide
param.PARA: The transform object to compose with this one.

member.summary: Returns a new transform which is the composition of the given transform (on the right side) and this one (on the left side).

remarks.PARA: Returns a new transform that is the composition of this transform and the specified transform.

This function performs the same operation as the method of . However, this method returns the transform of most suitable type based on the types of the transform objects being composed. For example, if you compose two linear transforms, the resulting transform is linear.

The order in which you compose transformations is important. If you have a transform that maps AFromB and another that maps BFromC, you compose the two to get a single transform that maps AFromC as follows: AFromB.ComposeBase(BFromC). You do not use: BFromC.ComposeBase(AFromB).

returns.PARA: An that represents the result of the composition.
