member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogFrameGrabber.Disconnect(System.Boolean)
member.param: Determines whether the connection to hardware can be re-established. It should always be set to true unless it is being called just prior to program termination.
member.summary: Breaks the connection between this software object and the hardware and cleans up the internal software objects. This function should be called whenever something has caused the state of the hardware to get out of sync wit the software state (i.e. power is temporarily lost to a camera). It should also be called prior to exiting the application.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogFrameGrabberCVM.CVMID
member.summary: Returns the id of any attached CVM.

remarks.PARA: Returns the ID of any attached CVM. The CVM ID is the same as the CVM number. For example, the ID of CVM11 is 11.

Returns −1 if the frame grabber supports CVMs but there is no CVM present.
Returns −2 if the frame grabber has no CVM connector.
See the example to learn how to test whether your frame grabber supports CVMs.
Use for informational purposes only and not as a substitute for querying the capabilities of your frame grabber such as ..

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogGraphicHighlight.HighlightColor
member.event: Fires when this property changes.
member.summary: Get or set the color of the highlighted feature.

member.exception: If you attempt to set HighlightIndex to a value less than -1.

member.value: The number of outstanding requests for highlighting.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogGraphicHighlight.HighlightRequest
member.summary: Enables highlighting by incrementing HighlightRequested.
member.event: Fires to indicate that HighlightRequested has changed.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogGraphicHighlight.HighlightRelinquish
member.summary: Decrement the HighlightRequested reference count, unless it is already zero. If HighlightRequested reaches zero, highlighting is disabled.
member.event: Fires to indicate that HighlightRequested has changed.

exception.para: , , , and describe a region that is not entirely within the image.

member.summary: Get objects that can be used to directly access each plane of pixel memory. The caller MUST call Dispose on each of these objects when finished with them.

remarks.PARA:
Gets an object for each plane of this image. The returned objects can be used to access pixel memory directly. You must call each object's
method when you are finished with it.
The , , , and parameters let you specify the portion of the image to get. To access the pixel memory for the entire image, specify zero for these parameters.

If you request read/write or write-only access to the pixel memory when you call , the pixel memory may be copied internally. Any changes that you make to the pixel may not be written back to the image until you call . Your application should assume that no changes to the image take place until then.

param.name: dataMode
param.PARA: Specifies whether the pixel data are read, write, or read/write.

param.name: height

remarks.PARA:
Gets an object that can be used to access pixel memory directly. You must call this object's
method when you are finished with it.
The , , , and parameters let you specify the portion of the image to get. To access the pixel memory for the entire image, specify zero for these parameters.

If you request read/write or write-only access to the pixel memory when you call , the pixel memory may be copied internally. Any changes that you make to the pixel may not be written back to the image until you call . Your application should assume that no changes to the image take place until then.

exception.para: , , , and describe a region that is not entirely within the image.

returns.PARA: An object that represents the pixel data.

member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to directly access pixel memory. The caller MUST call Dispose on this object when finished with it.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage8PixelMemory

remarks.PARA: Interface to an object that provides direct pointer access to 8-bit image pixel memory. Use to get an object.

objects are intended for temporary use within functions that read or write pixel data. Caching an object for long periods of time could lead to memory congestion. You must call when you are finished using the object to release any resources that it uses. After you do so, any pointer that returned becomes invalid.

If you request read/write or write-only access to the pixel memory when you call , the pixel memory may be copied internally. Any changes that you make to the pixel may not be written back to the image until you call . Your application should assume that no changes to the image take place until then.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogModelFeature.Polarity

event.para: Fires when the polarity changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the polarity of this feature.
The polarity of a given feature may be −1, 0 (undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or −1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry.

exception.para: The new value is not in .

member.summary: Returns/sets the polarity of this feature. The polarity of a given feature may be -1, 0(undefined), or +1. Polarities of +1 or -1 define where to find brighter pixels relative to the feature geometry, and 0 means undefined.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogModelFeature.Weight

event.para: Fires when the weight changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: Sets or gets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model.

member.summary: Returns/sets the weight of this feature. The weight of a feature determines its relative importance compared to other features of the model. The weight defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogModelFeature.ParentFeature

remarks.PARA: Returns this feature's parent feature if it has one

If this feature has a parent feature, its and are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight of this feature is its times the parent's effective weight. Similarly, the effective polarity of this feature is its times the parent's effective polarity.

member.summary: If this feature has a ParentFeature, then Weight and Polarity are defined with respect to the parent. The effective weight (or polarity) of this feature is its Weight (or Polarity) times the parent's effective weight (or polarity).

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogModelFeature.GetEffectiveWeight
member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective weight is the value of the Weight property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective weight is the Weight times the effective weight of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective weight of this feature
If this feature does not have a its effective weight is the value of . If it does have a its effective weight is the times the effective weight of the .

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogModelFeature.GetEffectivePolarity
member.summary: If this feature has no ParentFeature, then its effective polarity is the value of the Polarity property. If this feature has a ParentFeature, then the effective polarity is the Polarity times the effective polarity of the ParentFeature.

remarks.PARA: Returns the effective polarity of this feature.
If this feature does not have a its effective polarity is the value of . If it does have a its effective polarity is the times the effective polarity of the .

remarks.PARA: Returns the shortest distance from this shape to the given point in the shape's selected coordinate space. Points within closed shapes return a distance less than zero.
The distance is measured to a meaningful part of the shape. For example, in measuring the distance to a , only its center is considered meaningful, not the distance to one of the arms.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogShape.FitToImage(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogImage,System.Double,System.Double)

param.name: image
param.PARA: The image to fit to.

param.name: xScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the x-direction.

param.name: yScale
param.PARA: The amount to scale by in the x-direction. A value of 1.0 means to scale 100% in the y-direction.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its .
Different shapes behave differently when is called.

CELL.PARA: Scales the shape in the x- and y-directions according to the height and width of the image.
The ellipse is sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The principal axes of the ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The shape is guaranteed to be circular in the selected space name, but may not be circular in pixel space.

The arc or annulus section is centered in the image and sized to fit just within the image after and have reduced the image size. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space. The principal axes of the underlying ellipse are aligned with the image, not with the selected space name.
The line segment is centered vertically centered and is horizontal across the image. scales to the width of the image. is ignored.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained. and are ignored.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the image. and are ignored.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle. and are ignored.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties such that its default size is based on the image and its SelectedSpaceName. XScale and YScale are multipliers where 1.0 designates 100% scaling.

member.summary: Adjust the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside passed in rectangle.

remarks.PARA: Adjusts the shape's geometric properties so that the shape fits inside a given rectangle.
remarks.NOTE: The coordinates of the bounding box must be given in the same coordinate space as the shape.
remarks.PARA:
Different shapes behave differently when
is called.

CELL.PARA: The shaped is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle.
The shape is scaled to the size and location of the bounding rectangle. The resulting shape covers the range from 0 to 270 degrees in pixel space.
The line segment is centered vertically and horizontally across the bounding rectangle.
The line's reference point is centered in the bounding rectangle, and its rotation is maintained.
The centroid of the polygon is centered in the bounding box.
The point is centered in the bounding rectangle.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogTransform2D.BestFitLinearTransform(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double@)

param.name: fromPoints
param.PARA: An array of points, expressed in From coordinates, for which to apply .

param.name: rmsError
param.PARA: If you supply a value for , sets it to the RMS error of the points against the returned linear transformation. A value of 0 indicates that the returned transformation exactly maps the points. Note that the RMS error is measured in To space.

is the Root Mean Square (RMS) unweighted Euclidian error between two sets of corresponding points. Set A is composed of the given points (in From space) after they have been mapped through this transform into To space. Set B is the same points after they have been mapped to To space using the linear transform returned by this function.

returns.PARA: A object that describes the best-fit linear transform (the one that produces the smallest RMSError of any linear transform).

exception.para: Too few points were provided to compute a best fit linear transform.

member.summary: Returns a new linear transform which best describes this transform over the given set of points. The points must be expressed in 'from' coordinates.

remarks.PARA: Returns a new linear transform that best describes this transform over the given set of points. These points must be expressed in From coordinates. The returned transform is called the "best-fit linear transform" because it is guaranteed to produce the smallest RMSError of any linear transform.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogTransform2D.ComposeBase(Cognex.VisionPro.ICogTransform2D)

param.name: rightSide
param.PARA: The transform object to compose with this one.

remarks.PARA: Returns a new transform that is the composition of this transform and the specified transform.

This function performs the same operation as the method of . However, this method returns the transform of most suitable type based on the types of the transform objects being composed. For example, if you compose two linear transforms, the resulting transform is linear.

The order in which you compose transformations is important. If you have a transform that maps AFromB and another that maps BFromC, you compose the two to get a single transform that maps AFromC as follows: AFromB.ComposeBase(BFromC). You do not use: BFromC.ComposeBase(AFromB).

returns.PARA: An that represents the result of the composition.

member.summary: Returns a new transform which is the composition of the given transform (on the right side) and this one (on the left side).

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogRLERun
member.summary: This class holds data that describes a single run within a run length encoded image (CogRLEBuffer). Note that a run is limited to a maximum length of 255 pixels, so an actual run may be represented by several adjacent instances of this object. A default constructed CogRLERun (value and length both zero) is used to denote the end of each row within a CogRLEBuffer.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants

remarks.PARA: Enumeration for camera synchronization models used by the property which is supported only on the MVS-8100M.
For other frame grabbers that use CCF-based video formats, the sync model is described in the format name.
To learn more about synchronization models, see the topic Synchronization Models.

member.summary: Enumeration for camera synchronization models.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants.ExternalPixelDrive

remarks.PARA: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the positive-going logic drive signals coming from the camera on the H- and V- wires. The pixel clock coming from the camera is used directly to sample the image.

member.summary: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the positive-going logic drive signals coming from the camera on the H- and V- wires. The pixel clock coming from the camera is used directly to sample the image.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants.ExternalPixelSync

remarks.PARA: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the negative-going analog sync signals coming from the camera on the H- and V-wires. The pixel clock coming from the camera is used directly to sample the image.

member.summary: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the negative-going analog sync signals coming from the camera on the H- and V-wires. The pixel clock coming from the camera is used directly to sample the image.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants.ExternalPLLDrive
member.summary: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the positive-going logic drive signals coming from the camera on the H- and V-wires. The pixel clock is regenerated on the frame grabber using the phase locked loop circuitry.

remarks.PARA: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the positive-going logic drive signals coming from the camera on the H- and V-wires. The pixel clock is regenerated on the frame grabber using the phase locked loop circuitry.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants.ExternalPLLSync
member.summary: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the negative-going analog sync signals coming from the camera on the H- and V-wires. The pixel clock is regenerated on the frame grabber using the phase locked loop.

remarks.PARA: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the negative-going analog sync signals coming from the camera on the H- and V-wires. The pixel clock is regenerated on the frame grabber using the phase locked loop.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants.ExternalPLLComposite

remarks.PARA: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the composite video/sync signal. The pixel clock used to acquire samples is derived on the frame grabber using phase locked loop circuitry and the horizontal sync signal from the camera.

member.summary: The frame grabber derives sync from the camera using the composite video/sync signal. The pixel clock used to acquire samples is derived on the frame grabber using phase locked loop circuitry and the horizontal sync signal from the camera.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants.InternalDrive

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqSyncModelConstants.InternalComposite

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqTriggerModelConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for triggering image acquisitions.

remarks.PARA: Enumeration for trigger models. See .

If you are using a frame grabber that supports CVM11, you can specify encoder-triggered acquisition which is a special case of hardware triggering for line scan cameras. To use encoder triggering, set the trigger model as
or
and set the property.
Some trigger formats may not be available depending on the frame grabber you are using or on the version of VisionPro installed on your computer.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqTriggerModelConstants.FreeRun
member.summary: Acquires occur automatically at frame rate.

remarks.PARA: Acquisitions occur automatically at the highest frame rate that the camera and frame grabber support.
Your should not call or when using this trigger model.
When is False, no acquisition takes place until you enable triggers.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqTriggerModelConstants.Slave

remarks.PARA: This trigger model is used by slave acquisition FIFOs. You cannot pass this value to .
See to learn how to create slave acquisition FIFOS.

member.summary: Trigger model used by slave fifos - this is not settable.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqTriggerModelConstants.Semi

remarks.PARA: Acquisitions are primed by a call to or . The acquisition actually starts when a transition on an external trigger line is detected.
When is False, transitions on the input line are ignored until you enable triggers.
The transition on the trigger input line can be high to low or low to high. Use to change the polarity of the trigger line.

member.summary: Acquires are primed by a call to StartAcquire. An external trigger initiates the acquire.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqTriggerModelConstants.Auto
member.summary: Acquires are initiated by an external trigger. It is an error to call StartAcquire.

remarks.PARA: Acquisition starts when a transition on an external trigger line is detected. This trigger model is sometimes called a "hardware trigger." It is an error to call or .
When is False, transitions on the input line are ignored until you enable triggers.
The transition on the trigger input line can be high to low or low to high. Use to change the polarity of the trigger line.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqTriggerModelConstants.Manual
member.summary: Acquires are initiated by a call to StartAcquire.

remarks.PARA: Acquisition starts with a call to or . Since no I/O input lines are involved, this trigger model is sometimes called "software triggering."
When is True, acquisition starts as soon as possible after you call or . When is False, acquisition requests are queued until you enable triggers.
On the MVS-8100M and MVS-8100C, manual strobing should be used only during development and for diagnostic purposes. For production applications, always use hardware triggering to initiate strobes.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqOffsetClampConstants.Both
member.summary: Shift output pixel values and then clamp then.

remarks.PARA: Shift output pixel values in an acquired image by a fixed offset and then clamp them. Values below the minimum value after shifting are set to the minimum; values above the maximum after shifting are set to the maximum.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqOffsetClampConstants.Clamp

remarks.PARA: Clamp output pixel values in an acquired image to minimum and maximum values. Values below the minimum value are set to the minimum; values above the maximum are set to the maximum.

member.summary: Clamp output pixel values.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqOffsetClampConstants.None
member.summary: No clamping or offset.

remarks.PARA: Do not change output values in acquired images.

member.summary: 24 bit RGB with an 8 bit alpha byte.

member.summary: Packed 5-6-5 RGB images.

remarks.PARA: 16-bit RGB images packed as 5 red, 6 green, and 5 blue bits. The bits are packed like this: rrrr rggg gggb bbbb

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqFifoPixelFormatConstants.Format16Grey

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogModelFeatureIteratorAttributeConstants

remarks.PARA: Bit field of attributes for . The bits indicate the iterator methods that are valid at the current position of the iterator.

member.summary: Bit field of attributes for the iterator. The bits indicate which operations are available at the current position of the iterator.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogModelFeatureIteratorAttributeConstants.First
member.summary: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned at the first item in the sequence. In this state, there are no items before the iterator so calling MoveToPrevious will produce an error. Note that 'First' does not imply the iterator is valid.

remarks.PARA: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned at the first item in the sequence. In this state, there are no items before the iterator so calling produces an error. Note that being positioned at the first item does not imply the iterator is valid.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogModelFeatureIteratorAttributeConstants.Invalid

remarks.PARA: When this bit is set, the iterator is not in a valid state. Attempting to read or write item properties of an invalid iterator produces an error. Getting iterator attribute properties is allowed.

member.summary: When this bit is set, the iterator is not in a valid state. Attempting to read or write item properties of an invalid iterator will produce an error. Iterator attribute properties can still be read.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogModelFeatureIteratorAttributeConstants.End
member.summary: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned past the final item in the sequence and is invalid. In this state, calling MoveToNext or attempting to read item properties will produce an error. Moving to a valid item will validate the iterator.

remarks.PARA: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned past the final item in the sequence and is invalid. In this state, calling or attempting to read item properties produces an error. Moving to a valid item validates the iterator.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPolygonFillConstants
member.summary: Enumeration of selections for FillMode property in ICogPolygon.

remarks.PARA: Enumeration of selections for property in used to determine whether a point lies within a polygon. The two algorithms can produce different results.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPolygonFillConstants.WindingNumber
member.summary: Use the winding number algorithm to distinguish inside from outside for this polygon.

remarks.PARA:
Use the winding number algorithm to determine whether a point lies within a polygon.
A point is considered inside the polygon if an observer standing at a given point would make at least one revolution about the point as a ray that extends from the point to the polygon traces the shape from vertex to vertex.

Another way to describe this algorithm is to label each line segment − if it goes in a counterclockwise direction relative to the point and + if it goes clockwise relative to the point. Then trace a ray from the point through the polygon, adding 1 for each + segment crossed and subtracting 1 for each − segment crossed. If the result is not zero, the point is inside the polygon.
In the following picture, the point P is outside the polygon.
In the following picture the point Q is inside the polygon. (Under the EvenOdd this point would be considered outside the polygon.)

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogPolygonFillConstants.EvenOdd

remarks.PARA: Use the even/odd algorithm to determine whether a point lies within a polygon.
If a ray from a point crosses the polygon an odd number of times, the point is inside the polygon. If the ray crosses the polygon an even number of time, the point is outside the polygon.

In the following picture, the points P and Q are considered to be outside the polygon because a ray drawn from each point crosses the polygon an even number of times. The point R is inside the polygon because a ray drawn from it crosses the polygon only once.

member.summary: Use the even/odd algorithm to distinguish inside from outside for this polygon.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShapeCompositionModeConstants

remarks.PARA:
Enumeration of composite shape composition modes. Use
to set the composition mode. If the composition mode is , all of the composite shape's graphic properties (line style, width, color, and so on) are propagated to all of the subshapes.

member.summary: Enumeration of composite shape composition modes.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShapeCompositionModeConstants.Freeform
member.summary: In this mode, the shape will act as a conglomerate of shapes with many different colors, line styles, etc. Graphics properties of the composite are not propagated to the sub-shapes.

remarks.PARA: In this mode the shape acts as a conglomerate of shapes with potentially many different colors, line styles, and so on. Graphics properties of the composite shape are not propagated to the subshapes.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCompositeShapeCompositionModeConstants.Uniform
member.summary: In this mode, the shape will act as a single rigid unified shape, with one color, line style, etc. Graphics properties of the composite are propagated to the sub-shapes.

remarks.PARA: In this mode the composite shape acts as if it were a single rigid unified shape, with one color, line style, and so on. Graphics properties of the composite shape are propagated to the subshapes.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtractRankModeConstants
member.summary: Enumeration of possible shape ranking modes. The returned collection of shapes is sorted from highest rank to lowest. If more shapes than the maximum number requested are found then the lowest ranking shapes are discarded.

remarks.PARA: Enumeration of possible shape ranking modes. The returned collection of shapes is sorted from highest rank to lowest. If more shapes than the maximum number requested are found then the lowest ranking shapes are discarded.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtractRankModeConstants.Proximity
member.summary: Rank shapes based on their distance from the shape specified by the ProximityShape parameter. Shapes closer to the proximity shape rank higher.

remarks.PARA: Rank shapes based on their distance from the shape specified by the ProximityShape parameter. Shapes closer to the proximity shape rank higher.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtractRankModeConstants.Contrast

remarks.PARA: Rank shapes based on average contrast along their length. Higher contrast shapes rank higher.

member.summary: Rank shapes based on average contrast along their length. Higher contrast shapes rank higher.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogShapeExtractRankModeConstants.Perimeter

remarks.PARA: Rank shapes based on perimeter length. Longer shapes rank higher.

member.summary: Rank shapes based on perimeter length. Longer shapes rank higher.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants

remarks.PARA: Enumerates the standard mouse cursors used for tool graphics.

member.summary: Enumerates the standard mouse cursors that can be used with interactive graphics. The selected cursor will appear in the display whenever the mouse is hovering near the interactive graphic.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.SkewHandle

remarks.PARA: A handle cursor used to indicate that a handle is used for skew.

member.summary: This cursor indicates an interactive 'handle' graphic. Manipulating the handle will change the skew of the graphic to which the handle is attached.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.RotateHandle

remarks.PARA: A handle cursor used to indicate that a handle is used for rotation.

member.summary: This cursor indicates an interactive 'handle' graphic. Manipulating the handle will change the rotation of the graphic to which the handle is attached.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.AspectConstrainedSizeHandle
member.summary: This cursor indicates an interactive 'handle' graphic. Manipulating the handle will change the size of the graphic to which the handle is attached, while retaining that graphic's aspect ratio.

remarks.PARA: A handle cursor used to indicate that a graphic is resizable but that its aspect ratio is fixed.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.UnconstrainedSizeHandle

remarks.PARA: A handle cursor used to indicate that the graphic can be resized without restriction.

member.summary: This cursor indicates an interactive 'handle' graphic. Manipulating the handle will change the size of the graphic to which the handle is attached.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.ManipulableGraphic
member.summary: This cursor indicates an interactive graphic that can be selected and manipulated.

remarks.PARA: An attention cursor used to indicate that a graphic is manipulable.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.SelectableGraphic

remarks.PARA: An attention cursor used to indicate that a graphic is selectable (but not manipulable).

member.summary: This cursor indicates an interactive graphic that can be selected, but not manipulated.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.TipTextGraphic

remarks.PARA: An attention cursor used to indicate that a graphic has tooltip text available.

member.summary: This cursor indicates an interactive graphic that may have associated TipText, but cannot be selected or manipulated in any way.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogStandardCursorConstants.Default
member.summary: This cursor is the default for all interactive graphics. It appears as a small '+' in the display.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourSegmentIteratorAttributeConstants

remarks.PARA: Bit field of attributes for the iterator. The bits indicate which operations are available at the current position of the iterator.

member.summary: Bit field of attributes for the iterator. The bits indicate which operations are available at the current position of the iterator.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourSegmentIteratorAttributeConstants.First

remarks.PARA: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned at the first item in the sequence. In this state, there are no items before the iterator so calling MoveToPrevious will produce an error. Note that 'First' does not imply the iterator is valid.

member.summary: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned at the first item in the sequence. In this state, there are no items before the iterator so calling MoveToPrevious will produce an error. Note that 'First' does not imply the iterator is valid.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourSegmentIteratorAttributeConstants.Invalid
member.summary: When this bit is set, the iterator is not in a valid state. Attempting to read or write item properties of an invalid iterator will produce an error. Iterator attribute properties can still be read.

remarks.PARA: When this bit is set, the iterator is not in a valid state. Attempting to read or write item properties of an invalid iterator will produce an error. Iterator attribute properties can still be read.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourSegmentIteratorAttributeConstants.End

remarks.PARA: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned past the final item in the sequence and is invalid. In this state, calling MoveToNext or attempting to read item properties will produce an error. Moving to a valid item will validate the iterator.

member.summary: When this bit is set, the iterator is positioned past the final item in the sequence and is invalid. In this state, calling MoveToNext or attempting to read item properties will produce an error. Moving to a valid item will validate the iterator.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourDOFConstants.Position

remarks.PARA: Enables interactive manipulation of the X,Y position of the general contour. Changing the position will affect the Start and End points of all the segments.

member.summary: Enables interactive manipulation of the X,Y position of the general contour. Changing the position will affect the Start and End points of all the segments.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourDOFConstants.EllipticalArcConstrainedSpan
member.summary: Enables interactive manipulation of the curvature of elliptical arc segments, constraining them to pass through the endpoints and bend handle. This DOF allows the user to change the fraction of the full ellipse that appears between the arc endpoints.

remarks.PARA: Enables interactive manipulation of the curvature of elliptical arc segments, constraining them to pass through the endpoints and bend handle. This DOF allows the user to change the fraction of the full ellipse that appears between the arc endpoints.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourDOFConstants.EllipticalArcBend
member.summary: Enables interactive manipulation of the curvature of elliptical arc segments. Notice that changing the curvature is likely to affect the center, radii, rotation, start and span of the arc, but will not modify its endpoints.

remarks.PARA: Enables interactive manipulation of the curvature of elliptical arc segments. Notice that changing the curvature is likely to affect the center, radii, rotation, start and span of the arc, but will not modify its endpoints.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourDOFConstants.VertexPosition
member.summary: Enables interactive manipulation of the position of any vertex of the contour.

remarks.PARA: Enables interactive manipulation of the position of any vertex of the contour.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogGeneralContourDOFConstants.All

remarks.PARA: Disables interactive manipulation of the contour.

member.summary: Disables interactive manipulation of the contour.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants
member.summary: Enumeration of custom property types. Provides guidance as to what is a valid setting.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeUnknown
member.summary: Unknown type. Can be set, but no guidance for validity can be given.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeCategory
member.summary: Category feature. This feature simply contains other features.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeString
member.summary: String feature. Usually read-only things like version info.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeBoolean
member.summary: Boolean feature. Valid values are 'True' and 'False'.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeCommand
member.summary: Command feature. Feature cannot be set, only executed.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeFloat
member.summary: Float feature. Feature should be set to a numeric value.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeInteger
member.summary: Integer feature. Feature should be set to a numeric integer value.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCustomPropertyTypeConstants.TypeEnum
member.summary: Enumerated feature, use GetValidEnumValues() to determine valid settings.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVisionToolMultiThreadingThreadCountModeConstants
member.summary: Enumeration for vision tools multithreading modes.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVisionToolMultiThreadingThreadCountModeConstants.UserSpecified
member.summary: Specify that multithreaded aware vision tools should usethe user specified (via the ThreadCount property) number of threads.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogVisionToolMultiThreadingThreadCountModeConstants.HardwareDefined
member.summary: Specify that multithreaded aware vision tools should useas many threads as there are processor cores.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqROIModeConstants
member.summary: ROI Mode.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqROIModeConstants.Automatic
member.summary: Allows the acq software to adjust the ROI to the capabilities of the hardware and apply a window to the acquired image if the ROI is not supported in hardware.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqROIModeConstants.Manual
member.summary: Causes the ROI settings to be written directly to hardware, and the size of the acquired image will not be adjusted if it is larger than the requested ROI.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqCameraModeConstants
member.summary: Laser Height Camera Mode.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqCameraModeConstants.IntensityWithGraphics
member.summary: Camera outputs intensity image from sensor with added graphics showing the results of the laser peak detection algorithm. Output format is RGB planar.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqCameraModeConstants.Range
member.summary: Camera operates as a linescan camera and outputs range data in real world units. Output format is 16-bit greyscale.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqCameraModeConstants.Intensity
member.summary: Camera outputs intensity image from sensor. Ouput format is 8-bit greyscale.

member.summary: Laser Mode.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqLaserModeConstants.Strobed
member.summary: Laser only on during image exposure.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqLaserModeConstants.Off
member.summary: Laser always off.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogAcqLaserModeConstants.On
member.summary: Laser always on.

member.summary: The first image is acquired on an active-going edge of the trigger signal, and as long as the trigger signal remains active subsequent images will be acquired in a continuous fashion.

member.summary: Allows higher line rates than Standard mode, but with less accuracy.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.CogProfileCameraLaserDetectionModeConstants.Standard

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogCoordinateSpaceTree.TransformChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs after a transform is changed in this tree. Note that the meaning of any spaces descending from the changed transform will also be altered. This event can be fired in a variety of ways. For example: (1) by a call to the ChangeTransform method, (2) by call to the AddSpace method that replaces an existing transform, (3) by modifying a transform that was added to the tree by reference (not copied).

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.CogMaximizer.EvaluateEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs when the Execute method of CogMaximizer is run. Each time it is fired, the handler for this event must compute a Fitness value that corresponds to the supplied Position value. The Execute method continues to fire this event until it has determined which input Position value produces the highest output Fitness value (or until the event handler terminates the Execute method prematurely, by failing to set the Continue parameter to true.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICog1394DCAMAccess.BusConfigurationChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs when a bus configuration changed (e.g. unplugged or bus reset) is detected for this frame grabber.

remarks.para: This event fires whenever there is a change in the IEEE1394 bus configuration. In general, the only appropriate action for your application to take in reponse to this event is to terminate the application gracefully. Once this event fires, the acquisition hardware and software may no longer be consistent, and the only way to fix that is to restart the application.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogAcqFifo.OverrunEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs after a FIFO has missed a trigger. This usually means that triggers are coming in too fast to be processed.

remarks.PARA: Event fired from an when an overrun occurs.
The acquisition failed because even though the acquisition system was able to obtain the required resources, it was unable to start the acquisition in a timely fashion.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogAcqFifo.CompleteEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs after a FIFO has completed an acquisition, perhaps unsuccessfully. If the acquisition was unsuccessful, Acquire or CompleteAcquire will return an error. The acquisition may have been initiated by a call to Acquire, a call to StartAcquire, or by the acquisition system if you are using auto-trigger mode.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogAcqFifo.MovePartEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs when an acquisition FIFO determines that the camera's field of view can be changed without affecting the acquired image.

remarks.PARA: Event fired from an acquisition FIFO when the camera's field of view can be changed without affecting the acquired image.

With interlaced video formats an acquisition enters the movable state during the acquisition's next-to-last vertical blank interval. With an RS170 camera, for example, an acquisition would enter the movable state 17 ms (one field time) before it enters the state.

Some frame grabbers, such as the MVS-8100L and the MVS-8100M, cannot detect the next-to-last vertical blank interval. When using one of these frame grabbers, the acquisition enters the movable and complete states at the same time. In such cases, the move-part event always fires first, followed immediately by the event.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.ICogAcqFifo.FlushedEventHandler
member.summary: Occurs after an acquisition FIFO is flushed.
